Rice Terraces and Zhuang Villages- The following day you’ll travel from Yangshuo to Ping’an. This takes about 3.5 hours and you’ll pass green rice paddies and traditional villages along the way. Next you’ll visit the village of Ping’an, home to some of the most picturesque rice terraces in Asia. You’ll spend the night in a modest guest house surrounded by mountains and rice terraces. As there are no roads in Ping’an there is a short walk up the rice paddies to reach your guest house. Over the last few years, Ping’an has increased in popularity and has attracted more tourists. However, there are still plenty of quieter places that your guide will take you to. With your guide you will hike through rice paddies that stretch as far as the eye can see you’ll notice just how very special this part of China is.

Skyscrapers of Hong Kong- Next, you’ll take your luggage back down to the car park where a transfer will be waiting to take you on the 2.5 hour drive back to Guilin. From here you’ll catch the bullet train to the city of Guangzhou, roughly a 3 hour journey east of Guilin. Travelling by train is much less expensive than flying directly into Hong Kong. A driver will be waiting to transfer you between train stations in Guangzhou. Your train ride to Hong Kong will take another 2 hours and on arrival you’ll make your own way to your comfortable hotel in the popular Kowloon area of the city. Gaze out over the harbour in Hong Kong, a place packed with endless possibility. With tongue-tingling cuisine and thriving traditional culture, it’s bewitching. Stare down upon silver skyscrapers from Victoria Peak, wander around bird markets and share steaming dim sum. You’ll spend two nights in a Kowloon hotel and during your stay you’ll get to visit all the big highlights of the city, from Victoria Peak to the up and coming suburbs where designers and artists are flourishing.
Departure- Unfortunately all good things must come to an end and today your China holiday must draw to a close. You’ll arrange your own transfer to the airport to catch your flight back to the UK.

tourName: China tour with Pandas and Yangtze cruise
generalInfo: Discover China’s iconic landmarks and its beloved national treasure—the giant panda—on this 13-day “China Essence & Panda Tour.” The journey begins in Beijing with a visit to the scenic Mutianyu section of the Great Wall, followed by a flight to Xi’an to explore the awe-inspiring Terracotta Warriors. Savor authentic local flavors in the Muslim Quarter before heading to Chengdu, where you’ll take part in an exclusive Panda Keeper Program at the Dujiangyan Panda Base—helping prepare food and clean enclosures while directly supporting conservation efforts. Cruise through the breathtaking Three Gorges on the Yangtze River, soaking in dramatic cliffs and serene landscapes, then continue to vibrant Shanghai to experience the striking contrast between historic charm and futuristic skyline along the Bund. Designed with sustainability in mind, the itinerary minimizes flights by using China’s high-speed rail network, supports locally owned restaurants and guesthouses, and includes meaningful cultural exchanges—like a dumpling-making session with a Xi’an family and a traditional tea tasting in Chengdu.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Beijing. Your private guide will be ready to meet and greet you at the arrival hall. A comfortable private car with an experienced driver will transfer you directly to your hotel. Meals:No

Beijing. Wander through Tian'anmen Square, the largest city square in the world, and arrive at the Forbidden City, the largest imperial palace in the world. Experience the charm of the hutongs, a network of historic alleyways lined with traditional courtyard houses. This one-hour rickshaw tour will take you through narrow streets, into a local home, and across the Silver Ingot Bridge. Learn about the distinctive characteristics of these disappearing courtyards. Meals:Breakfast and Lunch

Beijing. Freshen up in the morning and start your day at the Temple of Heaven, which was the place where emperors prayed for a good harvest. Ceremony. Then continue to the Great Wall at Mutianyu, which is the section ranked top on TripAdvisor among all the Great Wall sections Meals: Breakfast, Lunch

Beijing to Xi'an. Walk around the tranquil Summer Palace at a leisurely pace and enjoy the 300-year-old royal garden. Enjoy some Beijing roast duck for lunch. In the afternoon, you will be driven to the train station for your high speed train to Xi'an. Meals: Breakfast ,Lunch

Xi'an. Visit the the Terracotta Army. Have a silent conversation with the warriors and listen to their stories spanning over 2,000 years. Then discover a local craftsman's cave dwelling and learn how to make clay warriors with your own hands. After lunch, return to the city area and visit the 600-year-old ancient city wall. Meals: Breakfast, Lunch

Xi'an to Chengdu. Discover more ancient history at Little Wild Goose Pagoda. It houses a collection of Buddhist artifacts and becomes a symbol of Xi'an's rich heritage. From the top level of the pagoda, you will see a panoramic view of Xi'an. Join a local family and learn how to make Jiaozi, Chinese dumplings. This interactive experience offers a unique opportunity to connect with Chinese culture. Enjoy the special lunch of your homemade dumplings. Finally, hop onto a high-speed train for a 4-hour journey to Chengdu. Meal: Breakfast, Lunch
Chengdu. Get very close to pandas and learn more about them during the Panda Keeper Program in Dujiangyan Panda Base. Meal: Breakfast and lunch

Chengdu to Chongqing. Start your day at Chengdu People's Park to experience an authentic local life. Begin your journey with a cup of tea. Next, venture to Jinli Old Street, where you can taste delicious local snacks. Try some famous foods, such as bean jelly in chili sauce, sweet potato noodles, and Sichuan-style wontons. Take the bullet train to Chongqing after the tour and then check-in for a Yangtze River cruise that departs at 9 pm. (Note: Fares for Yangtze River cruises vary depending on departure date, cruise line, and cabin category/ship class.) Meal: Breakfast, lunch and dinner

Yangtze River Cruise. Take a shore excursion to Fengdu Ghost City in the morning. Enjoy the cultural activities on the ship in the afternoon and a night show — War Fires of the Three Kingdoms (optional) after dinner. Meal: Breakfast, lunch and dinner

Yangtze River Cruise. Visit White Emperor City to see 10-yuan banknote scenery, calligraphy inscriptions. Cruise through the spectacular Qutang Gorge and the magnificent Wu Gorge at noon. Enjoy a shore excursion to Shennv Stream in the afternoon. Enjoy the Crew Cabaret and Talent Show after dinner on the ship. Meal: Breakfast, lunch and dinner

Yichang to Shanghai. Disembark in the morning, and then join the shore excursion to the Three Gorges Dam. You will be transferred to the tourist center in Yichang city after the tour. Your private guide and driver will escort you to the railway station on time for your bullet train journey to Shanghai. Meal: Breakfast and lunch

Shanghai. Travel back in time to the golden age of the Bund in the 1920s during our In-Depth Bund Culture Discovery Tour. Enjoy lunch and ascend the tallest building in China — Shanghai Tower. Enjoy freetime in the afternoon. Meal: Breakfast and lunch
Shanghai departure. Say goodbye to Shanghai and China. Enjoy a private transfer to the airport.

tourName: Chinese Kung Fu exploration trip
generalInfo:
Our spectacular 17-days Chinese Kung Fu Exploration Trip will offer participants wonderful experiences and range of authentic insights into this famous martial art. The tour begins in China’s capital city, Beijing, which has seen rapid change in recent years to become one of the world’s most spectacularly cities. However, our itinerary will ensure that participants experience both the ancient and the modern, and cultural highlights will include a city tour of the incredible Forbidden City, the Temple of Heaven, and Tiananmen Square. We will also visit the Beijing Huiling Community Services for Persons with Intellectual Disabilities centre, which will provide an exceptional opportunity to learn from and engage with others with very different needs.

After we sample Beijing, our journey will then take participants to the uniquely spectacular Great Wall (a famous UNESCO World Heritage Site). Over the next few days, participants will then be fortunate enough to walk along some of its most impressive sections and the views that will be afforded will simply take your breath away, especially from Simatai! We will visit a range of small, picturesque villages in the regions beyond Beijing, including the beautiful water town of Gubei before moving onto Luoyang. From here, we then take you to Dengfeng where participants will learn about Zen culture and Kung Fu from the Shaolin monks, and of course, experience the famous Shaolin Temple!

Our journey then continues in the beautiful city of Xi’an, famous for its old city walls and its impressive bell tower. Xi’an acts as a perfect platform to visit the amazing Terracotta Army (also a UNESCO World Heritage Site) that includes more than 6,000 individually crafted soldiers of stunning detail. Other additional stops will include Mount Wudang, (a location strongly linked with the origins of Chinese Kung Fu) and Wuhan. The final step of the tour takes us to the futuristic-looking city of Shanghai, which is beautiful blend of modern buildings and historical cultural heritage!

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL BEIJING You will be met at the airport by our guide and transferred to a hotel in central Beijing. Today you will have an opportunity to rest and recover from the long flight.

BEIJIKNG HIGHLIGHTS: After breakfast, we will go to see the local people doing their morning exercises and join them to learn Taiji from the master in Temple of Heaven. Tai Chi, or Taijiquan in China, is an outstanding gem of traditional Chinese culture that is valuable in promoting health, developing combat and self-defence skills, and improving concentration and overall well-being. Then we will visit the Temple of Heaven. Temple of Heaven was the venue for the Ming and Qing emperors to offer sacrifices to the Heaven and pray for harvest. This temple was built in the 18th year during the reign of the Ming Emperor Yongle in 1420. After have one hour visit in Panjiayuan Antique Market, go to a local restaurant to enjoy a traditional Chinese lunch. Then we will drive to Tian’anmen Square, which is the biggest central square in the world and is located in the center of the Beijing city. Here you could see the Monument to the People's Heroes, Great Hall of the People, Mao Zedong Mausoleum and the national flag raising and lowering ceremony. Thousands of people come to the Square every day. After that follow in the footsteps of emperors, court ministers and eunuchs and head south to the magnificent and colorful Forbidden City. Forbidden City Beijing, also called Imperial Palace Museum, is located in the very heart of Beijing. It remained the residence of the emperors for nearly five hundred years, from the 15th century to the early 20th century, and was the actual and symbolic seat of imperial power. Popularly known as the Forbidden City, it was built in the Ming Dynasty between the 4th and the 18th years of the Yongle period (1406 - 1420 AD). Many of the buildings of the Palace have been repaired and rebuilt, but their basic form and layout remain in their original state. Go to Jingshan Park to enjoy a bird view of the Forbidden City. Visit Hutong neighborhood, dumpling making and lunch at a Hutong family’s house. Overnight at a 3 or 4 star hotel in Beijing. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

BEIJING HIGHLIGHTS: Today, we will first go to visit the Capital Museum, This afternoon, we will transfer to visit Summer Palace. Summer Palace located in a northwestern suburb of Beijing, it is an immense park containing some Chinese traditional architecture and arts. It was built and served as a royal garden during the Qing Dynasty. It exhibits the quintessence of the Chinese classical landscape gardening. The halls, the pavilions, the corridors, the pagodas, the bridges and the water were elaborately arranged. The long Corridor is one of the most exquisite structures in the garden. It is over 700 meters long and decorated with thousands of Chinese traditional paintings. At the end travel back to the city to enjoy a delicious Peking Duck dinner - the capital's most famous dish. Once imperial cuisine, now the legendary duck dish is served at restaurants around the world. This evening we will go to watch a Chinese opera performance. Overnight at a 3 or 4 star hotel in Beijing. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

BEIJING-LONGQUANYU-XIAOXIHU: We will go to Huiling Community Services, making dumpling or learn how to cook China dishes with children (based on the number of participants). Beijing Huiling Community Services for Persons with Intellectual Disabilities seeks to improve the lives of the mentally disabled. Through community-based activities, BJHL facilitates trainees' independence and teaches life skills. At here, our students will have a chance to share their life experience with these children. After lunch, we will drive about 2 hours to the village named Longquanyu to enjoy a fairly easy walk experience. The hike is through a stunning steep-sided gorge. Towards the end of the walk you will reach the lake of Xiao Xi Hu with breathtaking views of the Great Wall. During the hike, an interesting activity – Untie the Knot. Students will all be attached to a single rope and must work together to untie a messy knot in the middle, weaving themselves in and out of the tangled rope to do so. And when we arrive at the end point of today’s hike, we will walk cross the scenic spot to tonight’s lodging place. Overnight: Guest house near Huanghuacheng. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

HUANGHUACHENG-XIAOGUAI-GUBEIKOU(BLD) After breakfast, we will take 2hrs drive to Baihe Natural Rock Climbing Cliff ( also called Xiaoguai) where is one of the best places in Beijing to go rock climbing on natural cliffs. Both sides of the Baihe River Valley are steep and ideal for climbing. This morning, we will do a rock climbing challenge under special guidance of professional rock climbing coach. After a simple lunch box, drive to Gubeikou section of the Great Wall. Upon arrival, we will directly trek 2hrs to tonight’s camping site. Today’s hike will take us to a military area along the Wall, which we must bypass. We will take a pleasant diversion to a friendly village where will be our tonight’s camping site. At 18:00pm, we will start our tonight’s BBQ dinner and bonfire party which will be arranged at the yard of local guest house. Camping at the bottom of the Great Wall

CAMPSITE-GUBEIKOU-JINSHANLING-GUBEI WATER TOWN: We will be up before sunrise to catch the sun throwing soft morning light onto the Wall itself, great for pictures! Simple breakfast will be followed, then we will continue to hike from our camping site eastward to Jinshanling section of Great Wall. The panoramic view is wonderful – partway along the hike. After a 2.5 hours hike, we will arrive at Shayukou Tower, you could down to the bottom of Jinshanling Great Wall through a mountain path. From here, for the participants with good physical strength, they could continue to hike 2.5hrs eastward to Erchu ( Wuyan tower), where we could enjoy a good view of Simatai Great Wall and overlook the surrounding. Then we will down to meet the driver in the parking lot at the bottom of Jinshanling. A short drive will take us to Gubei Watertown at the bottom of Simatai Great Wall. Gubei Water Town is situated in Gubei Township of Miyun County northeast of Beijing, hence the name of Gubei Water Town. It has a charming location with a massive backdrop of the world famous Simatai Great Wall, accompany of the romantic Yuanyang Lake ( Mandarin Duck ) and the ancient Simatai Village that was developed from Simatai Castle built during the reign of Emperor Wanli ( 1573 -1620 ) in Ming Dynasty ( 1368 – 1644 ). So the Gubei Water Town resort is a rare combo of Great Wall, Mountains, Lakes and Ancient Villages. Check in the guest house and have a short rest, tonight we will have a chance to visit evening Simatai Great Wall. Overnight: Guest House in Gubei Water Town. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

GUBEI WATER TOWN-LUOYANG(by train): Orienteering and treasure hunting in the water town to build teamwork, try new things, and explore areas of interest in Gubei Water Town. And we will walk to a workshop to learning tie-dye or wood sculpture drawing with veteran craftsmen. After a farewell lunch, drive to Beijing West Railway Station, take a high-speed train to Luoyang. You will be picked up by local guide at the exit of train station and transfer to the hotel. Then Overnight at a 3 or 4 star hotel in Luoyang. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

LUOYANG-DENGFENG: After breakfast, we will start to explore this cultural city of Luoyang. Enjoy your full day city visit that covers the most classic sites here of Longmen Grottos which overwhelmingly depicts Buddhist subjects, are densely dotted along the two mountains. Then have a visit to Luoyang Museum of Folk Customs, realizing the local culture and walk along Minng & Qing Old Town, exploring the history of this ancient city. In the late afternoon, take a 1.5-2hrs drive to Dengfeng, check in the hotel. Overnight at Shaolin Temple tourist resort. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

DENGFENG: Learn Zen culture and Kungfu from the Shaolin monks. In the afternoon, visit the famous Shaolin Temple and Pagoda Forest. Shaolin Temple is a world famous Buddhist temple in China, famous for Chinese Kung Fu or Martial Arts and the Zen Buddhism wide-spread in East Asia. During the visit, we will watch a spicy show of Shaolin Kungfu. Overnight at Shaolin Temple tourist resort. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included

DENGFENG-XI’AN(by train) Walk up in the early morning, do morning lessons with Shaolin monks, have breakfast with monks (vegetarian diet). After breakfast, sweep the temple, then continue to learn Shaolin Kungfu with masters After lunch, transfer back to Luoyang, take a high-speed train to Xi’an. Your local guide will pick you up at the exit of train station, then drie to the hotel and check in. Overnight at a 3 or 4 star hotel in Xi’an. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

XI’AN: After breakfast, we will drive to visit the magnificent Qin Terra-cotta Army. It was built in about 2500 years ago and contains more than 6000 warriors, soldiers and horses. UNESCO listed it in 1987 as one of the world cultural heritages. In the afternoon, drive back to Xian city; Followed by a stroll with our guide in the Muslim Quarter and the visit to the Big Mosque, where the way of life is markedly different from the traditions of the Han Chinese. For over 1,300 years, since the Tang Dynasty (A.D. 618 - 907), Muslims have been an integral part of daily life in Xi'an, the beginning of the Silk Road. Enjoy Chinese Dumpling feast with Tang Dynasty dancing show in the evening Overnight at a 3 or 4 star hotel in Xi’an. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

XI’AN- MT. WUDANG: After breakfast, begins our tour with a bicycle ride along the Ancient City Wall, the most complete city wall in China. The original foundation was based on the ruins of the Imperial City Wall of Chang’an City, the capital of the Tang Dynasty, known today as Xi’an. Though the wall has been entirely renovated, it still resonates with history. Then visit Shannxi History Museum. The Shanxi History Museum's permanent exhibition primarily displays Shaanxi's ancient history. Representative pieces from all periods have been selected to show the development of civilization in this region. After lunch, take about 4.5hrs drive to Mt. Wudang, another origin of Chinese Kung Fu, especially for its Taichi Quan, to continue your exploration. Stay in hotel at the foot of the mountain Overnight at a 3 or 4 star hotel in Wudang. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

MT. WUDANG: The local guide pick up from your hotel at the foot and start the exploration of Mt Wudang. Take green van into the scenic area, then take cable car up to the top of Mt. Wudang. Visit Zixiao Temple and Nanyan Temple considered the most spectacular of Wudang three famous temples. Have lunch at local restaurant on the mountain Explore and hiking on the top of Mt. Wudang as you like in the afternoon escorted by our local tour guide. Overnight at a 3 or 4 star hotel in Wudang. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

WUDANG-WUHAN(by train) Get up early in the morning, you can enjoy the fresh air veil the mountain and learn some basic move of Taichi Chuan with the local masters. Drive to Shiyan City and take D-train (about 4 hours) to Wuhan in the afternoon.. Overnight at 3 or 4 star hotel in Wuhan. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included. Breakfast and lunch included.

WUHAN-SHANGHAI(by air) Have leisure morning for you to pack and check out. The guide will meet you at the hotel lobby to have a glimpse of Wuhan. Take a visit to the Yellow Crane Tower. As one of the symbols of the Wuhan city, the Yellow Crane Tower is standing on the top of the Snake Hill. The Yellow Crane Tower is closely associated with its surroundings, in other words, the beauty of the tower is inseparable from its natural environment. Combining the classic poetry and modern beauty, the Yellow Crane Tower reflects the Chinese traditional customs of climbing mountains and getting close to the nature. Ascending to the Yellow Crane Tower, we can enjoy the fantastic scenery of Wuhan city and the mighty Yangtze River. After lunch, take an afternoon flight to Shanghai. Picked up by the local guide and check in the hotel. Overnight at a 3 or 4 star hotel in Shanghai. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

SHANGHAI: After breakfast, the local guide will pick you up at your hotel lobby at about 9 am. Today activities include visit Shanghai Museum, Yu Garden, The Bund, and go shopping on your own in the late afternoon. Shanghai Museum: Shanghai Museum used to be near the Bund. It is now situated in People's Square and its new buildings were built in 1996, designed by a Shanghai architect named Xing Tonghe. The new design symbolizes China's ancient understanding of the world: round sky and square earth. The museum has a circular roof and rectangular base. It stores 120,000 precious artifacts, which narrate a story of China's 5,000-year civilization. Yu Garden is one of the most famous gardens in China and is national heritage listed. It was built in 1559 and extended in 1577. Each section of the garden is separated by curved white walls crowned with the head and body of a dragon on them. It's named after the original owner. The Bund: Also called the Zhongshan Road, is a Famous waterfront and regarded as the symbol of Shanghai for hundreds of years. It was the Centre of Shanghai’s politics, economy and culture hundreds of years ago, consulates of most countries and many banks, bus nesses and newspaper offices were settled there. Overnight at a 3 or 4 star hotel in Shanghai. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.
DEPARTING SHAGNHAI: Breakfast served at hotel. Pick up from hotel and transfer to airport to take flight departing Shanghai and back home. Breakfast included. * End of Tour *

tourName: Classic Yunnan tour in China
generalInfo:
This 8-day expedition takes you deep into the heart of Yunnan, the province "South of the Clouds," where the ancient rhythms of the Tea Horse Road still echo through the mountains. Moving beyond the typical tourist trail, this holiday is designed for culturally curious travellers seeking to connect with the authentic lives of China’s ethnic minorities.

From the eternal spring of Kunming to the snow-capped spirituality of Shangri-La, you will traverse a landscape of dramatic geological contrasts and vibrant heritage. This is not just a sightseeing tour; it is an immersive journey through the history of the Bai, Naxi, and Tibetan people.

Why choose this holiday?

Immersive Living Heritage: We believe the best way to understand a culture is to touch it. You won't just look at textiles; you will visit the birthplace of Bai tie-dye art in Zhoucheng Village and craft your own indigo masterpiece alongside local artisans. You will engage with history by spinning the world's largest prayer wheel in Dukezong and walking the cobblestones of UNESCO-listed ancient towns.

Spectacular Landscapes: The route connects some of China’s most diverse geography. You will marvel at the surreal karst formations of the 270-million-year-old Stone Forest and stand in awe at Tiger Leaping Gorge, one of the deepest canyons on Earth. The journey ascends to the Himalayan foothills, where you will glide over the turquoise waters of Blue Moon Valley and witness the grandeur of Jade Dragon Snow Mountain.

Slow Travel & Authentic Vibes: We prioritise depth over speed. Whether it's cycling along the ecological corridor of Erhai Lake, exploring the bustling Dounan Flower Market (Asia's largest floral hub), or enjoying a private yacht cruise, the itinerary allows time to soak in the atmosphere. You will stay in carefully selected accommodations that reflect the local character, ensuring your rest is as culturally enriching as your exploration.

Inclusive Culinary Experience: We confidently cater to diverse dietary needs, including vegetarians and vegans. Yunnan cuisine is renowned for its "Kingdom of Mushrooms" status and incredible variety of fresh vegetables. We ensure that plant-based travelers do not just "get by," but enjoy a full, flavorful gastronomic journey featuring local specialties. Please specify your dietary requirements when booking. If all guests in your party are vegetarian, we will be delighted to arrange a comprehensive vegetarian meal plan for the entire trip.

A Spiritual Finale: The journey culminates in the mythological Shangri-La. Here, in the thin air of the high plateau, you will explore the magnificent Kalachakra Mandala Complex and experience the profound spirituality of Tibetan Buddhism. It is a fitting end to a trip that feeds both the eyes and the soul.

Join us for a responsible adventure that supports local traditions and showcases the raw, unpolished beauty of Southwest China.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN KUNMING Welcome to the 'Spring City'. Upon arrival, enjoy a private transfer to your boutique hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure to acclimatize and relax.

KUNMING HIGHLIGHTS Explore the geological wonder of the Stone Forest (UNESCO), a maze of limestone formations revered by the Sani people. Later, stroll through Green Lake Park, the vibrant heart of local life. Enjoy a Welcome Dinner featuring the famous 'Crossing the Bridge Rice Noodles'.

KUNMING - DALI Board a high-speed train to Dali. Cycle or drive along the ecological corridor of Erhai Lake, enjoying the breeze and views of the Cangshan Mountains. Visit Xizhou Ancient Town to admire traditional Bai architecture and witness the 'Three-Course Tea' ceremony, a cultural heritage symbolizing the philosophy of life.

DALI - SHAXI - LIJIANG Travel along the ancient Tea Horse Road to Shaxi, a beautifully preserved market town. Walk across the Yujin Bridge and explore the Sideng Square. Continue to Lijiang in the late afternoon. Evening leisure time to explore the cobblestone streets of Lijiang Old Town (UNESCO).

LIJIANG EXPLORATION Discover Baisha Village to see the mysterious Naxi Embroidery and frescoes. Visit the Jade Water Village to understand the Dongba culture. In the afternoon, experience 'Impression Lijiang', an open-air spectacle with the Jade Dragon Snow Mountain as the backdrop. Finish with a visit to Black Dragon Pool for the iconic photo of the mountain reflected in the water.

LIJIANG - SHANGRI-LA Drive to Shangri-La, stopping at the Tiger Leaping Gorge, one of the deepest canyons on earth. View the roaring Jinsha River. Upon arrival in Shangri-La, walk through Dukezong Ancient Town and spin the giant prayer wheel for blessings.

SHANGRI-LA IMMERSION Visit the Songzanlin Monastery, often called the 'Little Potala Palace', to immerse yourself in Tibetan spirituality. Visit a local Tibetan family for a home-cooked lunch and learn about their lifestyle. Afterwards, explore the pudacuo National Park (or Napa Lake depending on season) to see pristine lakes and alpine meadows.
DEPARTURE FROM SHANGRI-LA Enjoy a final morning at the bustling local market before your transfer to the airport for your onward journey. (Tour ends)

tourName: Delhi to Tashkent overland tour, Moghul Caravan
generalInfo: Follow in the footsteps of Babur, great grandson of Tamerlane, last of the Timurid Dynasty of Central Asia and founder of the Moghul Empire. Discover the highlights of Samarkand, Bukhara and Khiva as well as the stunning landscapes of Kyrgystan and northern Pakistan. Travelling across five countries, mountain ranges, remote valleys and great deserts you will encounter lands of ancient wonder and history.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: The adventure begins – join your Tour Leader and fellow travellers this evening as final preparations are made for your departure. Please meet your Tour Leader at 5:00pm for your Welcome Meeting as detailed on your Joining Instructions.

dayInfo.title: Delhi.
dayInfo.description: We begin our journey in Delhi and explore Old and New to discover its place in history and contemporary India. Old Delhi was built in the 17th century by the Moghul rulers and is home of the Red Fort and Jami Masjid Mosque. The bazaars of Chandi Chowk still offer up exotic treats before turning into tree lined avenues and the grand government buildings of New Delhi.

dayInfo.title: Shekawati.
dayInfo.description: No visit to India is complete without a visit to Rajasthan and we travel to Shekawati, known for its beautifully painted havelis which date back to the 18th century. After breakfast, we drive to an open gallery of India, Mandawa, a town situated in the heart of the Shekhawati region of Rajasthan.

dayInfo.title: To Jaipur.
dayInfo.description: This morning we explore more of Mandawa before heading south to Jaipur.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur.
dayInfo.description: Jaipur, the ‘Pink City’ where we venture to the Amber Fort, positioned imposingly above the city and offering up a myriad of intricately decorated rooms and a stunning view out over Moatha Lake. We also visit the City Palace and Jai Singh’s observatory purported to be based on the one designed by Ulug Bek in Samarkand 100 years before.

dayInfo.title: Agra.
dayInfo.description: Our journey through India continues via the fort of Fatephur Sikri, to the centrepiece of the nation, and the capital in the time of the Moghuls, Agra. The Taj Mahal, a striking monument to love by Shah Jahan is not to be missed.

dayInfo.title: Agra and to Delhi.
dayInfo.description: This morning, witness the surreal views of the Taj Mahal at sunrise, sparkling in the glittering rays of the Indian sun. Taj Mahal is an extravagant display of love, built by Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal.

dayInfo.title: Depart to Amritsar.
dayInfo.description: This morning we head to New Delhi railway station to board the train north to Amritsar, the holy city of the Sikhs and we are dazzled by the Golden Temple.

dayInfo.title: To Lahore.
dayInfo.description: We visit to Harmandir Sahib, known as the Golden Temple, the holiest site of Sikhism. Then we cross the border and journey on to Lahore.

dayInfo.title: Lahore.
dayInfo.description: Once the capital of the Moghul empire Lahore today boasts some remarkable architecture of this period, most notably the Lahore Fort, the Shalimar Gardens and the impressive Badshahi Mosque. We go to watch the infamous sunset flag lowering ceremony at Wagha, a display of cooperation or rivalry between the two nations. You can decide.

dayInfo.title: Islamabad.
dayInfo.description: We journey to Islamabad and en-route we will visit Khewra Salt mine, the second largest mine in the world discovered by Alexander’s troop in 320 BC.

dayInfo.title: Islamabad.
dayInfo.description: Today we have the opportunity to visit the ancient archaeological site of Taxila, now recognised by UNESCO and situated on the Grand Trunk Road.

dayInfo.title: Skardu.
dayInfo.description: Travelling north we board a scenic flight to Skardu, the gateway to the Karakoram mountains. Located on the Indus River, we explore the surrounding picturesque valleys and mingle with climbers who have come to attempt the summit of the infamous K2. *There is a possibility that our plans will be altered due to adverse weather. If our flight to Skardu is cancelled, we will drive up the Karakorum highway, stopping overnight in Naran and then resuming our journey from Gilgit.

dayInfo.title: To Gilgit.
dayInfo.description: We spend another day exploring this region with a visit to the Skardu Bazaar. We head to the bustling Gilgit, an important trading centre on the Silk Road and today the custom of exchange continues at the bazaar.

dayInfo.title: Hunza Valley.
dayInfo.description: We move on to the spectacular Hunza Valley and witness the most dramatic views from the Karakoram Highway with many snow-capped mountains including the imposing Rakaposhi at a massive 7788m.

dayInfo.title: Hunza Valley.
dayInfo.description: The mountains continue to deliver spectacular views in all directions.

dayInfo.title: Hunza Valley.
dayInfo.description: Duikar view point provides spectacular views across this mountain range. Baltit Fort sits at the foot of the Ulter Glacier with views of the Hunza Valley.

dayInfo.title: Cross the Khunjerab Pass into China.
dayInfo.description: We pass huge glaciers before crossing the Khunjerab pass into China, the highest point of our journey. Before crossing the border we pause in Sost, our last stop in Pakistan to stock up on snacks for the road. The locals will tell you that dried apricots, which the area is famous for, are great for helping with the elevation gain we'll be experiencing.

dayInfo.title: Tashkurgan and to Kashgar.
dayInfo.description: To the legendary Silk Road town of Kashgar, nestled between the Tien Shan to the north, the Pamir to the west and the Karakorum to the south and the largest desert in Asia, the Taklamakan to the east.

dayInfo.title: Kashgar.
dayInfo.description: Step back in time at the Sunday Market where trade continues in a time-honoured tradition, it is an absolute awakening for all your senses and an incredible experience.

dayInfo.title: Over the Irkeshtam Pass to Sary Tash.
dayInfo.description: Beyond Kashgar lie the high passes of the Tien Shan Mountains, gateway to Kyrgyzstan and the fabled cities of Central Asia. We follow the Silk Road over the Irkeshtam Pass to Sary Tash where we will spend the night getting to know some of the locals in a homestay.

dayInfo.title: Sary Tash to Osh.
dayInfo.description: This morning we travel further into Krygyzstan. Strategically located at the western gateway of the Fergana, Osh prospered during the time of the Silk Road until destroyed by Mongol armies in the 13th century.

dayInfo.title: Osh to the Fergana Valley.
dayInfo.description: Leaving Kyrgyzstan at Dostuk we travel into Uzbekistan and to the rarely visited oasis of Fergana Valley. With stunning scenery, distinctive architecture and traditional crafts from silk weaving and wood carving to pottery and knife making this makes for a worthwhile stop.

dayInfo.title: Fergana.
dayInfo.description: Explore the delightful market town of Margilan, where the friendly locals still dress in traditional costume. Margilan is also the home of ambr, a silk fabric which threads are dyed before wickerwork at the loom. You can see this process from its very beginning at the Yodgorlik Silk factory, hand made from cocoon to fabric as it has been for thousands of years. With hardly a tourist in sight take pleasure in the sights, sounds and aromas of the most interesting bazaar in the Fergana Valley.

dayInfo.title: Depart to Tashkent.
dayInfo.description: Continuing our journey we make our way on to the Uzbek Capital of Tashkent stopping en route at one of the country’s most ancient cities, Kokand before continuing by rail on to Tashkent. Tashkent is one of the oldest and largest cities in Central Asia, the Uzbek capital since 1930, and very much a showpiece of Soviet and post-soviet architecture.

dayInfo.title: Tashkent.
dayInfo.description: Tashkent cleverly juggles its cultural and historical past, the Soviet era's impact and modern day lifestyles. Get amongst the hyper-activity of the Chorsu Baazar found in the unique complex of trade halls crowned with magnificent blue domes. This is one of the oldest and largest Bazaar's in central Asia. Gather around one of the steaming street kitchens and sample some Plov, the king of Uzbek cusine.

dayInfo.title: Tashkent and to Khiva.
dayInfo.description: This morning we fly to the walled city of Khiva.

dayInfo.title: Khiva.
dayInfo.description: Today we explore in the wonderfully preserved city of Khiva – one of the finest examples of a Khanate fortified city and a living museum with mosques, madrassas and caravanserai crowded within its walls. Kunya Ark – a former residence of the Khan, the beautiful Kalta Minar minaret and the extraordinary Tash Khauli or ‘Stone Palace’ are among the prominent attractions.

dayInfo.title: To Bukhara.
dayInfo.description: A final morning in Khiva before we depart to Bukhara where we are treated to Central Asia’s most complete medieval city and revel in its beautiful traditional architecture as we walk through its history.

dayInfo.title: Bukhara.
dayInfo.description: Once known as ‘holy’ Bukhara, it was historically home to more than 2000 mosques. Today Bukhara’s monuments are some of the oldest on the Silk Road; the Ark Fortress, Samanid Mausoleum and the Kaylan Minaret – one of Central Asia’s tallest and so impressive that even Genghis Khan ordered it be spared from destruction during the Mongol invasions.

dayInfo.title: Bukhara.
dayInfo.description: Take your time here to explore the Old Town and enjoy some of the many chaikhanas (tea-houses) in Lyabi-Hauz, one of the most peaceful and interesting people-watching places in town.

dayInfo.title: To Samarkand.
dayInfo.description: We take the train through the desert to Golden Samarkand.

dayInfo.title: Samarkand.
dayInfo.description: Tamerlane – affectionately known in Uzbekistan as Timur – was dragged to Samarkand as a prisoner by an invading Mongol army. In the years following, his fortune improved and he returned and made Samarkand the capital of his Temurid realm. He and successive 14 & 15 century rulers shaped the city we see today. The madrassas of Registan Square and the mausoleum of Timur and his family – Gur-e-Amir – are sure to be highlights of your journey.

dayInfo.title: To Tashkent.
dayInfo.description: Our final train journey takes us back to the capital of Tashkent. Although much of the Old City was lost to an earthquake, Tashkent still retains some of its ancient treasures.

dayInfo.title: Tashkent.
dayInfo.description: Our adventure has drawn to a close. Say farewell to your travelling companions and tour leader before departing your hotel this morning.

tourName: Family holiday to China
placesVisited: Beijing, Great Wall, acrobatic show, Temple of Heaven Park, sleeper train to Xian, walking and biking tour of Xian, Terracotta Warriors, Chengdu, Renmin Park, Giant Panda Breeding Research Base, fly to Guilin, Yangshuo, cooking school & market tour, Tai Chi/Kung Fu class, day cycling with lunch in farmer’s restaurant, train to Hong Kong, explore Hong Kong
generalInfo:
This family holiday to China is a 14 day introduction to this vast and fascinating country that suits children aged five and upwards. Experience the colour, culture and natural beauty of China, visiting its world famous landmarks, shopping in local markets, spotting wildlife and learning how to cook Chinese food before winding up the holiday in Hong Kong, where old and new, East and West collide.

The holiday begins in Beijing. Here, you’ll explore the Forbidden City and Temple of Heaven, but also get a feel for modern China as you soak up the city’s atmosphere and people watch on its busy streets. From here, head to the Great Wall of China, climbing this extraordinary wonder and learning all about its history, too. You’ll explore the ancient city of Xian on foot then cycle its city walls and, of course, feast your eyes on the Terraccotta Warriors, lined up and ready for battle.

In Chengdu, meet the pandas nurtured at the panda research centre. You can watch them playing – ridiculously cute! – see red pandas and learn about conservation work. Then relax in Yangshuo, a peaceful town surrounded by a gorgeous landscape of karst peaks, where you can bike, take a kung fu or tai chi lesson, visit a farmer’s market and enjoy a cooking class.

Throughout this family holiday you’ll have the chance to meet China’s friendly people, too, with an overnight sleeper train an exciting way to spend time with locals and learn about Chinese culture, while racing through the landscape.

This is a small group holiday, max 16 people, with hotel accommodation and one night on a sleeper train.

dayInfo.title: Beijing.
dayInfo.description: Nimen Hao! Welcome to China. The capital of the most populous country on earth, Beijing is a place where ancient history and the modern world collide. Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 5pm today. Please look for a note in the hotel lobby or ask reception where it will take place. It’s important that you attend, as we will be collecting insurance details and next of kin information for each member of your family. If you’re going to be late, please let your travel agent or hotel reception know. After the formalities are out of the way, why not head out to enjoy an optional Peking duck group dinner and get to know each other over the first of many superb Chinese meals.

dayInfo.title: Beijing/Great Wall.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast get stuck into the sights with a visit to Tiananmen Square, the largest of its kind in the world and the symbolic centre of Chinese power. Take some time to soak up the immense size of the square and then continue to the maze of buildings that is the Forbidden City. Built more than 500 years ago and off limits to commoners for almost all that time, the courtyards, great halls and dragon and phoenix imagery give an idea of the might and grandeur of the Imperial Chinese court during the height of its power. Later travel by private minivan into the countryside, where you’ll spend the night in a family-run guesthouse right inside the scenic area near the Great Wall of China! Tonight it’s highly recommended that you go for a short hike to the Wall for an unforgettable sunset at one of the Seven Wonders of the World! Tonight for dinner, you'll be able to try your hand at dumpling making - sure to be a favourite activity for the kids!

dayInfo.title: Great Wall/Beijing.
dayInfo.description: This morning spend time exploring, taking photos and learning the history of the mighty Great Wall of China. An incredible piece of engineering, the wall stretches 6,000 km westwards from the mountain ridges north of Beijing. It was originally constructed to protect Chinese empires from the 'barbarians' of the north and even though it failed in this purpose, it's still without a doubt one of the country's most remarkable achievements and an iconic destination. You’ll often feel like you have the whole wall to yourself as you take your time strolling along the wall, which snakes through the hills almost endlessly into the distance. Being perched on this incredible engineering feat and surveying the spectacular surrounding countryside is an unforgettable experience. We then take the three-hour drive back to Beijing by private minivan. This evening, choose whether you would like to join your fellow family travellers for a group dinner. Hungry for more of China’s cultural delights? You may also choose to watch an optional acrobatic performance at the Chaoyang Theatre this evening.

dayInfo.title: Xian.
dayInfo.description: Jump on the bullet train to Xi’an and experience a form of rail travel like no other. While the distance would take around 11 hours to complete on a regular train, you’ll be in Xi’an in just over five hours, with great views of the countryside along the way! Arrive at around 3 pm and head to the hotel to drop off your bags and freshen up before exploring this historic city on a walking tour. Once known as the main eastern terminus of the ancient Silk Road, Xi’an served as the imperial capital of 11 dynasties and holds a wealth of history within its cobbled pavements. The city itself has spread beyond these walls, but the centre still retains the original grid formation, making it easy to navigate. Following your tour, the remainder of the afternoon is free to further explore. When night falls embark on another tour and see a different side of the city. Take in the view of the Bell and Drum Tower lit up against a black sky and sit down to a classic dumpling dinner.

dayInfo.title: Xian.
dayInfo.description: Today you’ll visit the vast, stone-faced army that is the Terracotta Warriors, a militia built to guard the tomb of Emperor Qin Shi Huang over 2000 years ago. Discovered by farmers in 1974, several pits are now open to the public. Make the 1.5-hour drive to the site and spend some time marvelling at the sheer size and detail of this impressive tomb. Head to the attached museum to see some more artefacts and learn a little more about the ambitious, eccentric ruler who remains sealed in his mausoleum surrounded by his soldiers to this day. Qin Shi Huang sought eternal life, and while he may not have achieved it in the literal sense, the fact that his creation remains a source of wonder to visitors from around the world is a kind of immortality.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu.
dayInfo.description: Wave goodbye to Xi’an and board a bullet train bound for Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan. Spend about 3.5 hours on the journey, arriving just after midday. Chengdu is most famous for two things – the pandas living in the mountains, and the delicious, spicy food. You'll get to enjoy both while you're here! Spend two-hours on a walking tour with your leader that takes in an Old Town that looks like a film set and the orange Tibetan Quarter, finishing at Tianfu Square, where a giant statue of Chairman Mao stands tall. Then spend a relaxing afternoon in bustling Renmin Park (People's Park), where you can mingle with locals drinking tea, exercising, singing, playing Mahjong or relaxing in bamboo chairs. Don't be surprised if somebody comes up to you with an offer to clean your ears! This evening, head out for a dinner of one of Sichuan’s most beloved dishes – the hot pot! This is the choose your own adventure of cuisine, and the whole family is sure to enjoy selecting which ingredients to add to the simmering broth.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu.
dayInfo.description: Embrace an early start to spend the morning watching gorgeous giant and red pandas in the Giant Panda Breeding Research Base. As pandas are only active for a few hours of the day, it’s important you rise and shine to catch them at their most interesting. China’s national pride, the giant panda is among the world’s most threatened animals, but here you can witness the conservation efforts and see these majestic creatures in a close approximation of their habitat. Spend three hours with these wonderful creatures, watching them play, eat bamboo and climb the trees. If you’re lucky (and visiting between July and September), you might even get to see newborns taking their first steps in the nursery. The rest of the day is free for you to spend as you wish. Maybe head to Wide and Narrow Alley, a popular set of alleyways where you can take a stroll and see craftspeople and food stalls aplenty.

dayInfo.title: Yangshuo.
dayInfo.description: Make sure you’ve got books or games ready for a full day of travel, beginning with ride on the bullet train from Chengdu to Guilin, followed by a two-hour transfer to Yangshuo. We will arrive at our hotel late in the afternoon. Located deep within the karst peaks of Guangxi province, Yangshuo is a haven for many visitors, away from the hustle and bustle of ever-developing China; a place where you can stop slow your pace and relax. Get settled into the hotel, which is located among stunning countryside, then head out for an optional dinner.

dayInfo.title: Yangshuo.
dayInfo.description: Rise and shine for a journey into one of China’s most enchanting landscapes. At 8 am you’ll strap on your provided helmet and jump on a hired bike to pedal out of town and through the surrounding countryside, past emerald-green karst mountains and lush fields. All equipment is provided for the bike ride: all bikes, helmets for both adults and children. The bike ride is from 8am to lunchtime. On the bike ride you will be accompanied with one or two local guides. You will be transferred back to the hotel after lunch to rest your weary legs! This evening we visit a local farmers' market, where you can get a feel for the regional produce and daily life. Then make a short drive to Chaolong, where you can put this new knowledge to use and learn the art of Chinese cooking. This class will allow the whole family to learn the techniques and skills of Chinese cuisine from experienced chefs, and after an afternoon trying out delicious recipes, you can eat what you’ve made for dinner! With recipes that are easy to make and ingredients readily available outside of China, you’ll soon be wowing friends and family back at home.

dayInfo.title: Hong Kong.
dayInfo.description: Today you’ll make the epic journey from Yangshuo to Hong Kong (leaving at 8am and arriving around 6pm) so it’s important to have books, games and devices at the ready. Even though there are power sockets on the train, it’s also a good idea to have any devices you wish to use fully charged, as they may be in use by other passengers. First, drive 2 hours by private bus to Guilin West train station, where you’ll take the bullet train to directly to Hong Kong (approx. 3 hours). After a short taxi ride (approx. 10 minutes) you will arrive at your hotel in the vibrant hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. If you have the time (and more importantly, the energy) after arriving and settling in to your hotel, you may wish to end the day with the Symphony of Lights, a spectacular laser show that plays out on the futuristic buildings along Victoria Harbour. The show starts at 8 pm, and it’s free to watch. If a day in transit has you feeling drained however, rest easy knowing you’ve got a full day tomorrow to explore the city.

dayInfo.title: Hong Kong.
dayInfo.description: Dive into Hong Kong after breakfast this morning on a leader-led orientation walk. Under Chinese rule since 1997, Hong Kong is a vibrant and fast paced city only minutes away from quiet islands and beaches. The entire day is yours to spend as you see fit. Hong Kong Island is a great area to explore on foot, with plenty of family friendly hiking trails on offer with varying levels of difficulty. The Peak offers stunning views over the city, and can be reached by several trails or alternatively by tram. Ask your leader for details, but make sure you pack snacks and water if you plan to hike – there are no replenishing stations along the way. A more relaxing way to spend an hour is the Stay Ferry Harbour Tour, which takes you past the city’s landmarks and around the stunning harbour. The Hong Kong Science Museum is perfect for families with young kids, particularly if you’re visiting in rainy season (April to June) and don’t want to risk being caught out. Many of the exhibits are interactive, and entry prices are reasonable. This evening, maybe head out for a final meal with your fellow families and toast to a trip well spent.

dayInfo.title: Hong Kong.
dayInfo.description: It’s time to end this enlightening journey into the heart of China – there are no activities planned for the final day and you can depart the accommodation at any time following check out.

tourName: Festivals in China holiday
generalInfo:
Small group for 6 persons.

Trip highlights:

Visit panda in Wolong Natural Reserve
Soft hiking in the fantastic Landscape: Shuangqiaogou Valley of Mt. Siguniang Shan and three holy mountains in Yading, Daocheng
Danba - one of the most beautiful village in China
Gyarong and Khampa Tibetan in Western Sichuan
Tibetan Buddhism monasteries: Tagong Monastery, Litang Monastery, and Sangpi Ling Monastery
Experience Mask Dance Festival of Tagong Monastery 2026
Experience Horse Racing Festival in Litang in 2026
Panorama from Balang Shengdu Village of 3 mountains - Gongga, Yala, and Qingrao
Decode the hidden Qingde Village with beautiful traditional white houses and Tibetan-Naxi Museum
Luding Bridge, a witness of Red Army's Long March

This is a special festival tour, we will experience two traditional festivals in Tibetan area Kham of western Sichuan: the mask dance (Cham) festival of Tagong Monastery and the Horse Racing Festival in Litang.

Some natural scenery and cultural elements of east Tibetan area Kham are planned in program: Panda in Wolong, "the Queen of Sichuan’s Mountains" - Siguniang Mountain, China's most beautiful countryside - Tibetan Villages in Danba, appreciating snow mountains Yala and Gongga from Tagong Grassland, white Tibetan houses at Qingde Town of Xiangcheng, and the three sacred mountains of Daocheng Yading (Xiannairi, Yangmaiyong, and Xialuoduoji) captured by American explorer Joseph Rock.

dayInfo.description: Chengdu - Wolong - Siguniang Shan Town Wolong National Nature Reserve, Shenshuping Panda Base, Mt. Siguniangshan In the morning drive to Wolong National Nature Reserve. It is one of the Chinese earliest natural reverses, which is rated the preservation zones network of “mankind and living beings” by UNESCO. Visit Shenshuping Panda Base in Wolong, about 70 pandas live here, it is the largest breeding center for giant pandas, integrating scientific research, feeding, breeding, reproduction, wildness training, etc. Then, proceed to Siguniang Shan Town via the Balang Tunnel. Siguniang Shan Mountain, also known as the Four Sisters Mountain, Four Girls Mountain or Four Maidens Mountain, boasts four peaks exceeding 5000 m in height. According to legend, each peak represents one of the four sisters. The highest peak, Yaomei Feng, symbolizing the youngest sister, stands at 6250 m and is revered as the "queen of Sichuan's peaks." In the afternoon enjoy a leisurely hike in the Shuangqiao Valley (Double-bridge Valley) of Siguniang Shan Mountain, renowned for its concentrated and enchanting scenery. If the weather permits, marvel at the breathtaking sunset views of Siguniang Shan Mountain (Four Sisters Mountain) from Maobiliang. 221 km, 4 hours 10 minutes Overnight at Cloud Inn (3200 m)

Siguniang Shan Town - Danba Wori Tusi Manor, Tibetan villages Jiaju and Zhonglu Drive to Danba, on the way visit Wori Tusi Manor, the former official residence of the local Tusi, a kind of imperial kingship leader. After that, drive to the Tibetan village of Jiaju, renowned as the most beautiful village in China. In Danba, the local inhabitants are known as Jiarong (Gyarong) Tibetans. Take a walk and explore the Jiaju village, where over a hundred buildings with the same architectural style, showcasing the distinctive and cohesive character of Jiarong Tibetan homes. Against the backdrop of the blue sky, these Tibetan residences, adorned in hues of red, white, and black, are scattered seemingly at random yet harmoniously along the valley's slopes from the base to the middle. Late in the afternoon visit the mysterious and beautiful Tibetan traditional village Zhonglu. There are ancient block towers with long history here. In autumn, the village is even more beautiful, and the trees are full of heavy pomegranates, pears, and apples, etc.. At the sunset, the whole village is shrouded in the afterglow of the setting sun. 110 km, 2 hours 26 minutes Overnight at Zongkar Homestay (2100 m)

Danba - Bamei – Tagong Cham without mask at Tagong Monastery. Visit Tagong Monastery In the morning drive to Tagong. Upon arrival at Tagong, watch the mask dance (Cham) in Lhagang Monastery (Tagong Si) of Sayka Sect. Today the monks perform the Vajra Dance without mask. Late in the afternoon visit the Lhagang Monastery (Tagong Si) of Sayka Sect, which is surrounded by three hills symbolizing three Bodhisattvas. It is said that the blessing of a reserved Jowo Shakyamuni image left by Wencheng Princess in this monastery to the pilgrims resembles the Lhasa Jowo Shakyamuni image in Lhasa. Then drive to the Balang Shengdu Village. From here, you can enjoy the panoramic view of the "golden mountains" at sunset: Gongga Mountain (7.508,9 m, also Minya Konka), Zhara Lhatse (5.884 m, also Jara or Yala), and Qingrao Mountain (5.305 m), when the weather is good. 176 km, 3 hours Overnight at Laga Pasture Homestay (3730 m)

Tagong Mask Dance Festival at Tagong Monastery. Gyergo Nunnery, grand mani wall, and Muya Monastery Participate in the Mask Dance Festival at Lhagang Monastery and enjoy the masked Vajra dance along with various religious praying activities. In the afternoon, visit a community library on Lagang Ranch, have a cup of coffee, and experience wearing Tibetan clothing. From here, there is a great view of Yala Snow Mountain. Overnight at Laga Pasture Homestay

Tagong - Xinduqiao - Litang Horse racing and Thangka exhibition in Tagong Participate in horse racing activities in the morning. The monks of Tagong Monastery recited scriptures and prayed for the horses, and then the horses flew away from the Muya Golden Pagoda towards the direction of Mount Yala. Don’t miss taking pictures of grand sunning Buddha’s portrait (Thangka exhibition) event. In the afternoon, you’ll drive on the zigzag road up to the mountain chain of Hengduanshan (Mt. Blocks), which extends from the north to the south. And drive westwards to Yajiang and enter the Yalong river ravine. In the afternoon arrival in the “world highland city" Litang (4014 m). 225 km, 5 hours Overnight at Litang Yalong Hotel (4014 m)

Litang Horse teams parading. Litang Monastery This morning, it is the warm-up for the Litang Horse Racing Festival, with horse teams parading. In the afternoon, visit Changqingchunke'er Monastery (also admits as Litang Si monastery) in the western suburb. The Litang Monastery, developed by the 3.th Dalai Lama in the year 1580, today, became the largest monastery of the Gelukpa Sect in south Kham. Litang is the homeland of 7th Dalai Lama, and some other living Buddhas were also born in Litang. You will visit the Renkang Old House - the residence of the 7th Dalai Lama in the Letong Old Town. Overnight at Yalong Hotel

Litang Litang Horse Racing Festival (Nomads Festival) The whole day take part in the Litang Horse Racing Festival, which will be held in late July and early August, and last 4 days. This morning, a grand opening ceremony will be held, featuring Guozhuang dance performed by thousands of Khampa people, numerous Khampa men riding horses and galloping on the grassland. The programs in the afternoon are horse racing on track, horseback shooting competition, horseback archery competition, etc. Today, you can also enjoy Tibetan opera performances. Currently the traditional festival has further developed. Besides the traditional horse racing, other activities like horsemanship, singing, dancing, national costume show, etc. have become part of the grand festival. Large-scale material exchange also takes place during the festival. Overnight at Yalong Hotel

Litang Litang Horse Racing Festival (Nomads Festival) The whole day take part in the Litang Horse Racing Festival. In the morning, you will enjoy traditional equestrian activities such as picking up the hada from the ground while horseback riding. In the afternoon, traditional equestrianism is also practiced, and the atmosphere is pushed to a climax by the "New (Old) Xiajiu Competition". Riders perform various difficult balance movements on horseback, and the ultimate combination of strength and flexibility causes the audiences to exclaim in surprise. Today, you can also enjoy Tibetan opera performances and Guozhuang dances. Overnight at Yalong Hotel

Litang - Qingde Village of Xiangcheng County Sangpi Ling Monastery, traditional white houses, Zangna Museum Drive over Mt. Haizi Shan to Zhongde Town, Qingde Village, Xiangcheng County, and stroll through the Tibetan countryside. The chic traditional white houses are built along the river and mountains, and they are scattered and integrated into the poetic countryside. On the way visit the Sangpi Ling Monastery of the Gelug School. Known as "the first palace of Kham", it is a great art museum: architectural art (the building of Sangpi Monastery has no construction drawing, it was built using traditional Tibetan construction techniques), painting art (Buddham art - mural and thangka paintings and decorative painting) and sculpture (bronze sculpture, clay sculpture, wood carving). In the afternoon stroll in the beautiful Tibetan rural landscape, photographing the traditional white houses. Then drive to Buji Village to visit the centuries-old Zangna (Tibetan-Naxi) Museum, it is an ancient castle with a history of more than 300 years. 215 km 3 hours 52 minutes Overnight at Kamsa Manor Hotel (2780 m)

Xiangcheng - Provincial Road 216 - Shangri-La Town Visit Yading - Chonggu Monastery, Chonggu Meadow, Pearl Lake, Xiannairi Mountain In the morning drive along the beautiful S216 road to Shangri-La Town, where the highlight of this journey is - Yading nature reserve, home of three sacred Tibetan mountains - Chenresig (Xiannairi, Avalokitesvara, 6032 m), Jambeyang (Yangmaiyong, Manjusri, 6033 m), and Chanadorje (Xialuoduoji, Vajrapani, 5958 m). The scenery here easily rivals that of national parks of the west such as Yellowstone and Yosemite in terms of spectacular, pristine mountain scenery. Visit Chonggu Monastery (3900 m) and proceed via Chonggu Meadow to Xiannairi Mountain with a mystery Pearl Lake (4100 m, Dumu Hu, Zhenzhu Hai) at its mountain foot. 115 km 2 hours 16 minutes Overnight at Holiday Inn Express Daocheng Yading (2900 m)

Shangri-La town Visit Yading with 3 holy mountains - Yangmaiyong, Xianuoduoji and Xiannairi Full day hiking in the fantastic Yading National Nature Reserve. Drive by local shuttle bus to the entrance of Yading Nature Reserve. Then trek to Luorong Cattle Farm (4150 m), which is located among the magnificent holy mountains Yangmaiyong, Xianuoduoji and Xiannairi. Virgin forests, brooks, shrubs, meadows, flowers... form a fantastic gallery. In June 1928, Dr. Joseph Rock had taken beautiful photos of the Yangmaiyong (6033 m) and Xianuoduoji (5958 m) mountains on the Luorong meadow. And his masterpiece was published by the American "National Geographic". Many nature lovers were inspired by his experiences and the three holy mountains. There you can also watch the back of Mount Xiannairi. If you have interest, you can challenge the trekking to the amazing Milk Lake (4500 m, Niunai Hai) and Five-color Lake (4600 m, Wuse Hai)! Overnight at Holiday Inn Express Daocheng Yading Breakfast

Shangri-La Town - Daocheng - Litang - Xinduqiao Return trip, panorama view of Mt. Gongga Today drive via Daocheng, Litang, and Yajiang back to Xinduqiao, the “Paradise of Photographers”, a small town on the road juncture where the northern route of Sichuan-Tibet Highway (Chengdu - Lhasa) and the southern route of Sichuan-Tibet Highway (Chengdu - Lhasa) meet. When the weather is good, you can see the main peak of Gongga Mountain (7508.9 m, Minya Konka, “the King Peak of Sichuan”) from Xinduqiao. 417 km 7 hours 16 minutes Overnight at Xinduqiao Yake Hotel (3460 m)

Xinduqiao - Kangding – Luding - Chengdu Museum of Ganzi Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Luding Iron Chain Bridge on the Dadu River In the morning drive to Kangding. In good weather, you can admire the panorama of Gongga Mountain from Siding Tso Lake and Zheduo Pass (4298 m). Kangding is the capital of the Ganzi Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture and the gateway to the Tibetan Kham region. And Kangding has made a great contribution to fostering the contact and connection between the Tibetans and Han Chinese throughout history. In Kangding, visit the Museum of Ganzi Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, which houses rich cultural relics, including the Tent Made of Fur of Hundred Tigers, one of its prized collections, and it belonged to the Tusi - the chieftains of the Maoya steppes in Litang. Keep driving to Luding. In Luding visit the Luding Iron Chain Bridge on the Dadu River, which is a treasure of Chinese ancient architecture. The bridge was built in the 44th year of Kangxi in Qing Dynasty (1705) in order to enhance the connection with Tibetan culture. On May 29th, 1935, the Chinese Red Army reached Luding Bridge during the Long March. Facing a hail of bullets, the Chinese Red Army, with 22 warriors as the pioneers of the commando, destroyed the bridge’s guards in one fell swoop, which is an important historical monument of the Communist Party of China. Then drive via the famous rainy city of Ya'an back to Chengdu. 355 km 6 hours 21 minutes Breakfast

tourName: Guilin & Yangtze river cruise holiday, China
generalInfo: Take a Li River Cruise and enjoy the stunning and picturesque scenery along the Li River. Head to Chongqing ,stroll the narrow streets with old wooden houses in Ciqikou Old Town,and enjoy some local food and snacks. Lastly, get to the Yangtze River Cruise, a spacious cabin with a private balcony will let you wake up to uninterrupted views of the legendary scenery of the Yangtze.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Guilin. Explore an amazing limestone cave in the afternoon. Take a picture of the landmark of Guilin, Elephant Trunk Hill before checking into your hotel

Li River Cruise from Guilin to Yangshuo(B, L). A cruise along the Li River between Guilin and Yangshuo is an unforgettable experience. As you take in the stunning scenery, there's something interesting to see at almost every bend in the river. Check in to your hotel in the peaceful countryside of Yangshuo after the cruise. Your guide will show you around by bike to enjoy the beautiful Yulong River and the rice paddies with backed by the charming limestone hills.

Guilin to Chongqing (B, L). Drive back from Yangshuo to Guilin. Take the morning bullet train from Guilin to Chongqing (approximately 4.5 hours). Upon arrival, your local Chongqing guide will meet you at the train station. Climb the steps of the Shancheng Alley and encounter numerous historical sites such as the old city walls and foreign consulates. Visit one of Chongqing's current hot spots, the magical Kuixing Building. End your day at Hongya Cave, celebrated for its stunning night views.

Chongqing(B, L): Begin your day in the well-preserved Ciqikou Ancient Town, indulging in some shopping and taste local snacks. Next, marvel at the unique sight of a light rail train passing through a building at Liziba Station, then visit the Great Hall of the People. Before embarking on the Three Gorges cruise, visit the Three Gorges Museum.

Yangtze River Cruise(B, L, D). Take a shore excursion to Fengdu Ghost City in the morning. There are many buildings built according to traditional Chinese geomancy and statues and artwork reflecting Chinese people's imaginations of the netherworld. Enjoy the cultural activities on the ship in the afternoon and a night show — War Fires of the Three Kingdoms after dinner.

Yangtze River Cruise(B, L, D). If you are interested in Chinese calligraphy and history, the optional excursion to White Emperor City is a nice choice. Cruise through the spectacular Qutang Gorge and the magnificent Wu Gorge at noon. In the afternoon, enjoy a shore excursion to Shennv Stream. There, you will take a boat to discover this tributary of the Yangtze River, with its clear water running southwards through deep and narrow gorges. Enjoy the Crew Cabaret and Talent Show after dinner on the ship.

Yichang Departure. Disembark in the morning, and then join the shore excursion to the Three Gorges Dam. Getting access to a platform by the dam, you will enjoy the magnificent scenery of this super project and the Yangtze River. You will be transferred to the Yichang Cruise Terminal in Yichang city. Your private guide and driver will wait for you there and will transfer you to the airport or railway station. Note: The shore excursions in the itinerary are arranged by Century Cruises. They could vary depending on the cruise you choose.
