dayInfo.description: Hong Kong: Your China backpacking adventure kicks off today! Upon arriving in vibrant Hong Kong, you'll meet your group and Adventure Leader in the mid-afternoon for a trip briefing, where you'll get the lowdown on the incredible journey ahead. Next, we’ll take you up Victoria Peak for your first breathtaking view of the city—watch as the sun sets over the iconic skyline. To round off your first night, we’ll head to the bustling Temple Street Night Market, where your Adventure Leader will guide you to the best spots for a delicious late-night bite and an introduction to Hong Kong’s electrifying street scene.

Yangshuo: Rise and shine! This morning, we’re off to the train station to catch a high-speed bullet train to Guilin. From there, a scenic bus ride will take us to our hostel in Yangshuo, arriving by early evening. Once settled in, you can head out to explore the town and grab your first taste of the delicious local cuisine—your adventure in Yangshuo is just beginning!

Yangshuo: Today you have a free day to do what you want. However, you can take part in some of our suggested optional activities - (You can either join a traditional Chinese cooking class at a practical cuisine institute, kayak along the picturesque Li River or experience traditional Chinese therapy such as hot cupping (suction cups on the back that help circulation).

Yangshuo: Start the morning off with a relaxing bike ride and cruise down the Yulong River on Chinese style gondolas. On your first afternoon in Yangshuo you can take part in our optional activity - (Hop on the minibus to Moon Hill and visit the local mud baths, cave complex and hot springs). In the evening let your hair down enjoy some karaoke with your fellow travellers!

Yangshuo: Today you free to do what you want. But you can take part in some of our highly recommended optional activities - (Rock climb to the top of the regions limestone peaks or experience what life is like on a local farmland visit your Adventure Leader's home village).

Chongqing: Today we bid farewell to your Adventure Leader in Yangshuo and set off for the next leg of your journey — Chongqing, China’s mountain metropolis. Once you’ve checked in and dropped your bags, it’s time to hit the water for a Yangtze River cruise. Watch the skyline come alive as neon lights shimmer across the water — a truly spectacular way to see this city in all its nighttime glory. Afterwards, we’ll make our way to Hongya Cave, an eight-storey wonder of wooden balconies, glowing lanterns and buzzing food stalls perched above the river. Wander through its winding corridors, grab some street food or find a cosy spot for dinner with a view. It’s a feast for the senses and the perfect way to wrap up your first evening in Chongqing!

Chongqing: Kick off the morning with an optional visit to Liziba Station, where Chongqing’s monorail famously zips straight through a residential building — an engineering marvel that perfectly sums up this city’s wild, vertical personality. From there, dive into Chongqing’s fascinating past as you explore hidden air raid shelters, now transformed into creative underground spaces that reveal another side of the city. Next, stop by the grand People’s Great Hall, whose sweeping architecture reflects the city’s post-war ambition and pride. This afternoon, you can opt to explore Chaotianmen Dock, the dramatic meeting point of the Yangtze and Jialing Rivers, before winding your way up to Eling Park for panoramic views across the city’s layered skyline. As night falls, follow your Adventure Leader to the lively Guanyinqiao Area, where neon lights, bustling restaurants and vibrant bars set the scene for an unforgettable evening in China’s mountain metropolis.

Chengdu: This morning, wave goodbye to your Adventure Leader in Chongqing and board the train bound for Chengdu, the relaxed heart of Sichuan Province. Once you’ve arrived and settled into your accommodation, the rest of the day is yours to explore at your own pace. If you’re up for it, meet your new Adventure Leader for a gentle afternoon stroll through People’s Park, where locals sip jasmine tea, play mahjong, and practice tai chi beneath the shade of old trees. Then wander through the lively Kuanzhai Alley, a maze of restored courtyards filled with artisan shops, snack stalls and teahouses that perfectly capture Chengdu’s easygoing spirit. As the evening unfolds, grab dinner at one of the many nearby eateries — perhaps trying your first taste of the city’s legendary Sichuan spice!

Chengdu: Wake up early to go and visit the Chengdu Breeding & Research Center. Get up close and personal with pandas and learn about how the centre breed and release them into the wild. Here, you will have a Mandarin lesson with your Adventure Leader in the afternoon and in the evening you can take part in some of our suggested optional activity - (Go and experience the Sichuan opera and culture show - a one of a kind performance with acrobats, dancers, and puppets).

Chengdu: Today you free to do what you want. But, you can take part in some of our suggested optional activities - (Travel to Leshan and see the largest stone Buddha in the world (it’s 70m tall!) or have a try of the Sichuan Hot Pot, an authentic fiery Chinese speciality). In the evening take some time to kick back and enjoy a night out in Chengdu with your group!

Xian: Wave goodbye to your Adventure Leader in Chengdu and hop on the train to Xi’an, one of China’s most storied cities and the ancient starting point of the Silk Road. After checking in and settling into your accommodation, it’s time to get your first taste of the city’s rich history. You can opt to cycle along the Ming Dynasty City Walls, the best-preserved in all of China, for sweeping views of both old and new Xi’an. Or, dive straight into the city’s vibrant culture with a visit to the Bell and Drum Towers, before wandering through the Muslim Quarter, where centuries of Silk Road influences blend into a maze of lanterns, spices and sizzling street food. As night falls, tuck into Xi’an’s famous local snacks — from hand-pulled noodles to juicy lamb skewers — and browse the lively Silk Road night market for souvenirs, trinkets and a taste of the city’s timeless charm.

Xian: Wake up and travel to see the Terracotta Warriors, made up of life-size terra cotta sculptures in battle formations. In the evening you can take part in some optional activities - (Spend your evening watching the music and light fountain show in the Big Wild Goose Pagoda).

Shaolin: In the morning board a private minivan and then transfer to a bus to DengFeng. Once you arrive in Shaolin, it's time to take part in our next activity ~ Put your strength and flexibility to the test in a Kung Fu lesson and show at a local Kungfu Children's Home. For your evening meal, you will have dinner at your guesthouse and enjoy another Mandarin lesson - good luck/Yiqie` shu`nli`! Let's end the night with a pub quiz!

Shaolin: Today you’ve got two incredible options to choose from. You can journey to the legendary Shaolin Temple, the birthplace of Kung Fu and one of China’s most sacred sites. Wander through ancient courtyards where monks have trained for centuries, then hike up to Dharma Cave, a peaceful mountain spot for Buddhist pilgrims with breathtaking views across the valley below. Prefer a different kind of awe? Head instead to the Longmen Grottoes, a UNESCO World Heritage site home to thousands of intricate Buddha carvings etched into the cliffs along the Yi River — an unforgettable window into China’s spiritual past. This evening is free to relax, grab dinner at your own pace, and get a good night’s rest — you’ve got another big day of adventure ahead!

Beijing: Arrive at Beijing and transfer by minibus to your hostel. (You won’t be staying at this hostel, but will be able to use their facilities). You will then board a bus and make your way to The Great Wall in the afternoon. Hike on an unrestored part of the wall and enjoy the glorious views. As a group, you will eat dinner at a local farm and then begin your hike to an unrestored section of the wall, where we will have the place to ourselves! When you arrive you will set up camp and settle down to watch the sunset over the Wonders of the World before pitching up your tent for a night camping. (Please note, due to cold weather before the end of April and after September, we stay in a guest house near the Wall instead of camping but still return to the Wall to watch the sunrise in the morning).

Beijing: Wake up early for a once-in-a-lifetime moment — watching the sunrise over the Great Wall of China. As the first light spills across the ancient stones, take a deep breath and soak it all in — it’s a view you’ll never forget. (Weather dependent, but always worth the early start!) After returning to Beijing, the rest of the day is yours to explore at your own pace. You might choose to wander the creative 798 Art District, where modern galleries and street art fill converted factory spaces, or stroll the tranquil gardens of the Summer Palace, surrounded by willow-lined lakes and ornate bridges. Prefer to keep the group vibes going? Team up with your travel crew and discover more of the city’s treasures — from hidden hutong cafés to bustling local markets. However you spend it, today’s the perfect mix of freedom, culture, and unforgettable views.

Beijing: Begin the day with the option to cross Tiananmen Square, the heart of modern China, before stepping through the grand gates of the Forbidden City — the world’s largest palace complex. Once home to 24 emperors, its maze of courtyards, golden roofs, and hidden chambers is packed with centuries of intrigue and imperial history. For a panoramic finale, climb up Jingshan Park, a peaceful hill offering sweeping views over the palace rooftops and Beijing’s skyline beyond — the perfect photo spot. As evening falls, the choice is yours. You could catch an incredible Chinese acrobatics show, where balance, strength, and precision take centre stage, or feast on Beijing’s legendary Peking Roast Duck, a dish once reserved for royalty and now one of China’s most celebrated culinary experiences.

Beijing: Spend your final day in Beijing your way. You could browse the city’s bustling markets for souvenirs and quirky finds before visiting the nearby Temple of Heaven, where locals gather to play cards, practice tai chi, and sing in open-air choirs. Or, dive into Beijing’s cultural heart with a visit to the Nanluoguxiang district, one of the city’s best-preserved historical areas. Wander through the maze of hutongs and siheyuan courtyards, stopping at cosy cafés, boutique bars, and family-run craft shops along the way — the perfect blend of old and new Beijing. As evening falls, make your way to the station and board the night train to Hangzhou. Settle into your sleeper cabin and drift off as the lights of the capital fade behind you — the next chapter of your China adventure awaits.

Hangzhou: Arrive in Hangzhou in the morning and make your way to your hostel for a late breakfast. You will visit the famous West Lake and take a boat tour around one of the islands. In the afternoon you'll check into your hostel, where you'll have time to take part in some optional activities - (You can learn about China’s trade history with a visit to the China National Tea Museum or visit the National Silk Museum). In the evening as a group we will hike up to the top of Jiuyao Mountain just in time to catch the sunset over West Lake.

Hangzhou & Shanghai: Get up early and hike to the Nine Creeks, a trail hidden in the mountains in the West Lake Scenic Area of western Hangzhou city. After the hike, you will return to your hostel and check out and enjoy some lunch. In the afternoon hop on a train to Shanghai. When you arrive in Shanghai you will make your way to the hostel via metro. In the evening you can take part in our suggested optional activity - (Enjoy a river cruise down the Huangpu River).

Shanghai: Wake up ready for your next Mandarin lesson taught by professional teachers from a Chinese Language School. Later on in the day, you'll be able to take part in a variety of optional activities - (Walk to the Yu Gardens, a garden located beside the City God Temple, explore the People’s Square, head to Nanjing Road - the world's busiest shopping street or set off for the Shanghai Drunken Panda Pub Crawl).

Shanghai: Today is all yours to spend however you like! Feeling adventurous? Head to Disneyland and enjoy a full day of rides, shows, and magical moments. More into culture? Explore the treasures of the Shanghai Museum or wander Moganshan Art Street to soak up the city’s creative side. If you’re craving a change of pace, take a trip out to Zhujiajiao Watertown, where canals, bridges, and historic architecture create a peaceful escape. Or, put your bargaining skills to the test at Shanghai’s famous fake goods market. However you spend it, today is all about enjoying Shanghai your way — a chance to explore, relax, and make the city your own.

Shanghai: Today, wander the leafy streets of the French Concession, where charming architecture meets hidden cafés, boutique shops, and quiet corners perfect for photos. Pop into a secret propaganda museum for a quirky slice of history, then lose yourself in the arty lanes of Tianzifang, full of galleries, craft shops, and vibrant street life. Next, venture into Shanghai’s ultra-modern financial district and head up Jinmao Tower for sweeping city views from the observation deck. Feeling brave? Step out onto the skywalk, 340 metres above the streets below, for a thrill you won’t forget! As evening falls, your Adventure Leader will point you to the best local spots for dinner and drinks, whether you’re after street eats, stylish bars, or a memorable night out in the city.

Fujian: This morning you will board a bullet train to Nanjing (approximately 7 hours and a half hours). Upon arriving in Nanjing you will take a minivan to the Fujian tea-growing hills. Here, you take the time to explore some local mud roundhouses - a traditional home of the Hakka Minority People. Later, hop on a minibus to Mr. Liu's house, where you'll enjoy an evening of relaxation.

Fujian: Start the day with a breakfast at your hostel followed by a tour around the UNESCO World Heritage Site, Fujian Tulou. Here, you'll visit the tea plantations where you'll be able to taste some of the local tea. In the evening you can take part in an optional activity. Optional Activities: (Join the rest of your fellow crew for a relaxed movie night).

Fujian & Guangzhou: Take a bike tour around the world's biggest roundhouse, Tulou and the local village nearby. In the evening you will have some free time to relax before boarding a train to Guangzhou. (approximately 9 hours)

Hong Kong: Arrive in Guangzhou and have some breakfast. Take the bus to the Hong Kong border, and it's time for your trip will end, so make sure you take the time to say goodbye to your fellow travellers and either head home or continue your travels!

Included activities:

Visit Temple Street Night Market (Hong Kong)
Bike & Bamboo Raft the Yulong River (Yangshuo)
Take a Yangtze River Cruise (Chongqing)
Discover Hongya Cave at Night (Chongqing)
Visit the Giant Panda Breeding Center (Chengdu)

dayInfo.description: Hong Kong: Your China backpacking adventure kicks off today! Upon arriving in vibrant Hong Kong, you'll meet your group and Adventure Leader in the mid-afternoon for a trip briefing, where you'll get the lowdown on the incredible journey ahead. Next, we’ll take you up Victoria Peak for your first breathtaking view of the city—watch as the sun sets over the iconic skyline. To round off your first night, we’ll head to the bustling Temple Street Night Market, where your Adventure Leader will guide you to the best spots for a delicious late-night bite and an introduction to Hong Kong’s electrifying street scene.

Yangshuo: Rise and shine! This morning, we’re off to the train station to catch a high-speed bullet train to Guilin. From there, a scenic bus ride will take us to our hostel in Yangshuo, arriving by early evening. Once settled in, you can head out to explore the town and grab your first taste of the delicious local cuisine—your adventure in Yangshuo is just beginning!

Yangshuo: Today you have a free day to do what you want. However, you can take part in some of our suggested optional activities - (You can either join a traditional Chinese cooking class at a practical cuisine institute, kayak along the picturesque Li River or experience traditional Chinese therapy such as hot cupping (suction cups on the back that help circulation).

Yangshuo: Start the morning off with a relaxing bike ride and cruise down the Yulong River on Chinese style gondolas. On your first afternoon in Yangshuo you can take part in our optional activity - (Hop on the minibus to Moon Hill and visit the local mud baths, cave complex and hot springs). In the evening let your hair down enjoy some karaoke with your fellow travellers!

Yangshuo: Today you free to do what you want. But you can take part in some of our highly recommended optional activities - (Rock climb to the top of the regions limestone peaks or experience what life is like on a local farmland visit your Adventure Leader's home village).

Chongqing: Today we bid farewell to your Adventure Leader in Yangshuo and set off for the next leg of your journey — Chongqing, China’s mountain metropolis. Once you’ve checked in and dropped your bags, it’s time to hit the water for a Yangtze River cruise. Watch the skyline come alive as neon lights shimmer across the water — a truly spectacular way to see this city in all its nighttime glory. Afterwards, we’ll make our way to Hongya Cave, an eight-storey wonder of wooden balconies, glowing lanterns and buzzing food stalls perched above the river. Wander through its winding corridors, grab some street food or find a cosy spot for dinner with a view. It’s a feast for the senses and the perfect way to wrap up your first evening in Chongqing!

Chongqing: Kick off the morning with an optional visit to Liziba Station, where Chongqing’s monorail famously zips straight through a residential building — an engineering marvel that perfectly sums up this city’s wild, vertical personality. From there, dive into Chongqing’s fascinating past as you explore hidden air raid shelters, now transformed into creative underground spaces that reveal another side of the city. Next, stop by the grand People’s Great Hall, whose sweeping architecture reflects the city’s post-war ambition and pride. This afternoon, you can opt to explore Chaotianmen Dock, the dramatic meeting point of the Yangtze and Jialing Rivers, before winding your way up to Eling Park for panoramic views across the city’s layered skyline. As night falls, follow your Adventure Leader to the lively Guanyinqiao Area, where neon lights, bustling restaurants and vibrant bars set the scene for an unforgettable evening in China’s mountain metropolis.

Chengdu: This morning, wave goodbye to your Adventure Leader in Chongqing and board the train bound for Chengdu, the relaxed heart of Sichuan Province. Once you’ve arrived and settled into your accommodation, the rest of the day is yours to explore at your own pace. If you’re up for it, meet your new Adventure Leader for a gentle afternoon stroll through People’s Park, where locals sip jasmine tea, play mahjong, and practice tai chi beneath the shade of old trees. Then wander through the lively Kuanzhai Alley, a maze of restored courtyards filled with artisan shops, snack stalls and teahouses that perfectly capture Chengdu’s easygoing spirit. As the evening unfolds, grab dinner at one of the many nearby eateries — perhaps trying your first taste of the city’s legendary Sichuan spice!

Chengdu: Wake up early to go and visit the Chengdu Breeding & Research Center. Get up close and personal with pandas and learn about how the centre breed and release them into the wild. Here, you will have a Mandarin lesson with your Adventure Leader in the afternoon and in the evening you can take part in some of our suggested optional activity - (Go and experience the Sichuan opera and culture show - a one of a kind performance with acrobats, dancers, and puppets).

Chengdu: Today you free to do what you want. But, you can take part in some of our suggested optional activities - (Travel to Leshan and see the largest stone Buddha in the world (it’s 70m tall!) or have a try of the Sichuan Hot Pot, an authentic fiery Chinese speciality). In the evening take some time to kick back and enjoy a night out in Chengdu with your fellow travellers!
Today marks the end of your adventure in China, as you say your final goodbyes to your travel crew and start planning your next adventure!

tourName: Horse riding tour around Hanas Lake, China
generalInfo:
This 7-day tour will ensure that you experience some of the most spectacular highlights of Xinjiang province and will provide a range of fantastic opportunities to see amazing landscapes on horseback. The itinerary commences in the province’s capital city, Urumqi, which is home to a range of markets that sell handicrafts and other products unique to the region. We then depart for Hemu via a number of small towns and through stunning mountainous vistas that trigger both a sense of awe and inspiration.

After a brief introduction to horse-riding, we will then take you to visit some of the most picturesque spots in the region, including Karakul Lake and Hanas Lake, which will include amazing views and relaxing sense of tranquility. Here, you will also encounter a local nomadic village that has remained largely unchanged since the peak times of the Silk Road several centuries ago. This experience in particular, is wonderfully unique and will give you an authentic sample of a very different way of life.

As we progress, you will be exposed to a rich array of wildlife and you will also encounter Crouching Dragon Bay, Moon Bay and Wild Duck Lake as we head towards Burqin before the tour ends. We are certain you will not find a better tour of Urumqi and the beautifully stunning surrounding region!

dayInfo.description: Home – Urumqi –Karamay (by air) Upon reaching Urumqi, the capital of Xinjang, you will be met at the airport and have a short briefing on the itinerary of this tour. You will find very little difference between Urumqi and other large inland cities in China. But the region's exotic feel persists, and the markets, such as the Kashgar Market and Erdaoqiao Folk Handicrafts Market, certainly exude the atmosphere of the Silk Road. To save the driving time for next day, we would drive directly toward Burqin right after the pick-up service, stay in a good hotel(4 star) in Karamay. Lunch and dinner included

Karamay – Burqin –Hemu: After breakfast, we will continue to drive to Burqin with beautiful scenery along the road. On the way, visit the Devil City, assembles a Herculean castle built in medieval Europe. Whenever the wind blows, the sky instantly turns pitch dark, with huge volumes of sand streaming in from nowhere, further drive Hemu passing the small town of Buerjin, a town inhabited mostly by the Kazaks. Stay in the hotel at Hemu. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

Hemu - Karakul Lake ( Black Lake)- Hanas Lake -Jiadengyu(BLD) Two days’ riding distance:35km, riding time:11hrs (we may take more time because of the little kids) This morning we will begin our horse-riding tour. Your local guide will arrange the horse and horseman for the tour follows. Before starting the tour there is a brief horse-ride training. From then on, the area we will pass is the exceptionally beautiful scenery untouched by tourists. The primary forest, the crystal Hanas River and Hemu River zigzag its way to far, the old wood bridge left from the age. You could visit the local nomadic village. We will spend the night at a charming lodge on the way (yurt near Karakul lake with public toilet). At arrival of Hanas Lake, time permit, the guide will take you to the north of the lake to the Fish Watching Pavilion on the peak of a mountain (2,030 m/6,660 ft). The pavilion will offer you an unobstructed view of the entire lake, tiers upon tiers of peaks, glaciers as well as the grand river valley where you trekked through the day before. After descending the mountain, you could go speed-boating along the 24 km (15 mi)-long lake. Then take a short drive to Jiadengyu where we will stay tonight. PS:Due to the limit of riding route condition, we simple picnic lunch will be arranged these two days. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

Jiadengyu – Hanas Lake –Burqin: This morning, after breakfast, we will drive back to Hanas Lake. Taking the shuttle bus to visit other places include Crouching Dragon Bay , the Moon Bay and Wild Duck Lake etc. The Crouching Dragon Bay , surrounded by a dense birch forest and set against a scenic backdrop of towering peaks, is a calm and serene sight. The lake is not alone here - a short distance away lies the mirror-flat Moon Bay , named after its perfect crescent shape. The Wild Duck Lake also deserves you to have a look, as wild duck, gooses and swans leisurely swim in the lake. Then go to visit local Tuvas’s house, to see what they will do in their daily life. After lunch, we will say “Good-bye” to the Hanas Lake, and drive first back to Jiadengyu, we will visit the Multi-colored Bay (Wucai Bay), Eerqisi Lake, Hedi night market, and further drive to Buerjin. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.
Burqin –Urumqi : Drive back to Urumqi, we will pass the Tuerban Tonggute Desert, and Kanameili Nature resort on the way. Stay in 4 star hotel in Urumqi. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.
Urumqi-Home: Transfer to the airport for the flight Home. Breakfast included.

tourName: Inner Mongolia horse riding tour, China
generalInfo:
Our 11-day Exploration Tour has been carefully designed to ensure that you experience some of the best highlights the north of China can offer. With a rich tapestry of history and culture, Beijing has a wide range of exciting things to explore. China’s capital city is has seen rapid change in recent years to become one of the world’s most spectacularly modern urban centres. However, our itinerary will ensure that you experience both the ancient and the modern and no tour to the region would be complete without a visit to the magnificent Great Wall which we will see at Mutianyu.

After we leave Beijing you will then be transported to a completely different world as we begin our horse-riding adventure! As we progress through Inner Mongolia we will traverse stunning locations of unimaginable beauty such as the Bayingcagang Grasslands and the crystal waters of Hulun Lake. We will also visit an important folk museum in Manzhoul to experience local customs and have uniquely authentic encounters with the local nomadic people as they share their histories and traditions with us. We will also visit the revered Ganzhuer Temple.

A further highlight is undoubtedly a stay at Arershan Forest Resort which will afford amazing views and a relaxing sense of tranquility. Here you will be able to unwind and experience nature at finest. Indeed, this is the perfect way to end the tour before we return to Beijing. We are certain you will not find a better tour of Beijing and the beautiful landscapes of Inner Mongolia!

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL BEIJING – TIAN’ANMEN SQUARE : You will be met at Beijing International Airport by our guide and transferred to Tian’anmen Square, walk cross the square, then drive to a hotel in central Beijing. Today you will have an opportunity to rest and recover from the long flight. In the late afternoon, you will enjoy a Peking duck dinner.

MUTIANYU GREAT WALL: Spend the day at the Great Wall of China, at Mutianyu, 70km north east of the city. This is one of the best-preserved parts of the wall and it features several unique characteristics in its construction, including three inter-connected watchtowers. Late afternoon and evening at leisure to explore Beijing. Breakfast and lunch included.

BEIJING - HAILAR : In the early morning, our guide will pick you up from the hotel and transfer to the airport, take a morning flight to Hailar. We’ll begin our adventure at the Yakeshi Ski Resort in Inner Mongolia. We’ll also stop in the way to buy any necessary supplies for horse-back riding if needed. The resort you’ll stay at is absolutely beautiful with its Russian-style wooden houses. After checking in we’ll head over to the riding start point and pick out our horses. Depending on your riding level we’ll also go over lessons on horseback riding safety and how-tos. From here we’ll head back to the resort, enjoy a nice dinner, and get some shut eye for the Inner Mongolia Adventure to come! Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

HORSEBACK-RIDING: Horseback Riding through Inner Mongolia is not only an adventure, but it is an opportunity to see some of the most beautiful, yet less traveled areas in not just Asia, but also in the World. We’ll start off the day with a nice, filling breakfast where after we’ll drive over to the stable, saddle up, and take our horses out for a warm-up trot in the hippodrome. Inner Mongolia’s sunrise, fresh air, and beautiful landscapes are unlike anything else in the rest of the world. We’ll spend the next two days horseback riding through Inner Mongolia’s forests until we reach its open, expansive, and famous grasslands. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

HORSEBACK-RIDING – BAYINGCAGANG GRASSLAND-KINSOM HAN: On day Six when we arrive at the Bayingcagang grassland, we’ll visit the local nomadic Mongolian families as they herd their cattle, hunt and fish. This is a great and rare opportunity to find out about the culture and history of Inner Mongolia and its people, as well as take amazing photographs. Drive to Kingsom Han. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

KINSOM HAN – MANZHOULI – HULUN LAKE (by 4WD jeep): Enjoy a half day horse riding tour in Kinsom Han, than transfer to Manzhouli. At arrival, meet and visit the Folk Museum to know something of the local tradition and custom. Drive to Hulun Lake, the fifth fresh water lake in China, covers an area of 2339square kilometer. The crystal water under the blue sky with thousands migrant around and the clean lakeshore make the Lake a ideal place to swim, enjoy sun-shower and taste the fresh fish feast from the Lake. Don't forget take your swimming cloth with you. Stay in the Hotel with hot-shower on the lakeshore. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

HUNLUN LAKE – BAODONG MOUNT – UERSHUN RIVERSIDE (by 4WD jeep): After breakfast, drive into the endless grassland, we will passby some the nomadic families on the way. We will visit one of the family on the way to see the real nomadic life. Drive across the wild grassland to the holy Mount of the local people---Baodong Mount., then sacrifase to Aobao----one of the worship ceremony more then thousand year old. Riding further on, Fishing at arrival. Camping at the lake side of Uershun. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

UERSHUN LAKE- GANZHUER TEMPLE –AERSHAN TOWN (by 4WD jeep) After breakfast, drive across the Uershun Bridge to Ganzhuer Temple. Ganzhuer Temple is one of the most famors Lama Temple in China. The rest tour we will drive not only across the grassland but into the endless forest until we arrive at the moutainous town. Stay in a similar 4-star hotel. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

AERSHAN FOREST RESORT: After breakfast, Drive to Arershan Forest Resort. Breath the fresh air on the mountain dotted by a lot of flower, trek part of the road to the Heavenly Mountain. Stay in the same. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.

AERSHAN FOREST RESORT – HAILAR- BEIJING (by 4WD jeep, by air) Drive back to Harilaer. It is the last day of the trip to enjoy the beauty of Grand Grassland. Take flight back to Beijing. The end of the adventure. Breakfast, lunch and dinner included.
DEPARTURE BEIJING : After breakfast at the hotel, we will transfer to Beijing International Airport for our return international flights. Breakfast included. End of the tour.

tourName: Japan and China highlights tour, 16 days
generalInfo:
Embark on a captivating journey through Japan and China during this mesmerizing 16-day tour.
This adventure tour guarantees unforgettable memories and a comprehensive exploration of the Far East, including iconic cities such as Tokyo, Hakone, Kyoto, Nara, Beijing, Xi'an, and Shanghai, all accompanied by our meticulously crafted itinerary and expert.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Tokyo. Our team will greet you and provide a private transfer from airport to your accommodation. Accommodation: 4 or 5 star hotel

Traditional Tokyo: Meiji Jingu Shrine, Sensoji Asakusa, Tokyo Skytree, Shibuya, and Omotesando. Immerse yourself in the vibrant tapestry of Tokyo, Japan's captivating capital, on an enthralling day trip that unveils the city's rich history, modern marvels, and cultural treasures. Begin your journey at the serene Meiji Jingu Shrine, a tranquil oasis nestled amidst the bustling metropolis. Stroll through the verdant Meiji Jingu Forest, admire the majestic Torii gate, and experience the profound tranquility of this sacred Shinto shrine.

Modern Tokyo: Tsukiji Fish Market, Hama-rikyu Gardens, Sushi-making experience with lunch, Anime cafe. This full-day trip offers a captivating blend of culinary delights, cultural experiences, and unique adventures, showcasing the diverse facets of Tokyo's vibrant charm. From the bustling Tsukiji Fish Market to the serene Hama-rikyu Gardens and the enchanting world of anime.

3-Day Hakone pass and Romance train ticket. Start your day by heading to Shinjuku station and using your Hakone pass and Romance car ticket for a direct train journey (90 minutes) to Hakone Yumoto station. From there, take the local train to Gora station and board a shuttle bus to your accommodation. Spend the rest time by your own arrangment, for example to visit Gora Park, a western-style landscape park with stunning views of Hakone, for a relaxing and scenic experience.

Explore Hakone on your own with the Hakone pass. You can use the pass to get on and off freely within a specified area, as well as providing discount admission to various attractions in the area. It covers 8 types of transport including trains, buses, cable cars, cableway and boat, sufficient to get you around all the major sights in Hakone.

Hakone to Kyoto by Shinkansen. Head to Odawara station by using your Hakone pass to travel, and then board the shinkansen to Kyoto. You will get the shinkansen ticket in Tokyo in advance). Upon arrival in Kyoto, make your way to your hotel and enjoy the rest of the day at your leisure.

Kyoto Highlights: To visit Nijo Castle, Nishiki Market, Kinkakuji Temple (Golden Pavilion), Pure Water Temple, and do Kimono wearing experience. Starting with Nijo Castle, visitors can marvel at its historic architecture and explore the beautiful gardens before heading to the bustling Nishiki Market, where they can indulge in a sensory journey through vibrant food stalls and traditional shops. The journey continues to the awe-inspiring Kinkakuji Temple, with its iconic golden pavilion set amidst tranquil surroundings. Afterward, the serene Pure Water Temple offers a moment of tranquility, inviting visitors to reflect and restore their spirits. Finally, the day culminates with an unforgettable Kimono wearing experience, allowing travelers to embrace the beauty and grace of traditional Japanese attire. This one-day trip in Kyoto guarantees a perfect blend of history, culture, and personal immersion, leaving visitors with cherished memories and a deeper appreciation of Kyoto's unique charm.

Nara Highlights and Fushimi from Kyoto. Engage in a mesmerizing Matcha-making Ceremony, where you can immerse yourself in the art of preparing and enjoying traditional Japanese tea. Explore Nara Park, home to friendly roaming deer, and enjoy the serene surroundings as you interact with these gentle creatures. Visit Todaiji Temple, housing the world's largest wooden building and a magnificent bronze Buddha statue and sample sake at a traditional brewery. On the way back from Nara, visit Fushimi Inari Shrine, which was featured in the movie Memoirs of a Geisha. This shrine is home to over 10,000 red torii gates that form a beautiful path up the mountain behind the temple.

Fly from Osaka to Beijing. Private transfer from Kyoto hotel to Osaka airport. Enjoy the air journey to Beijing, the Capital of China. Upon arrival, your local guide will meet you and transfer to your hotel. Enjoy the rest of the day at your leisure.

Beijing City Highlights: Tian'anmen Square, Forbidden City, Hutong, Lunch Beijing Roast Duck. Experience the highlights of Beijing City with a packed day of sightseeing. Begin at Tian'anmen Square, one of the world's largest public squares, before venturing into the magnificent Forbidden City, an ancient imperial palace showcasing exquisite architecture and historical artifacts. Next, explore the charming Hutongs, narrow alleys that preserve Beijing's traditional atmosphere and courtyard homes. For lunch, savor the renowned Beijing Roast Duck, a culinary masterpiece of succulent duck with crispy skin.

Great Wall and Temple of Heaven. Begin your day of touring in Beijing by visiting the Temple of Heaven, a historically significant site where emperors prayed for prosperous harvests. Arriving early allows you to witness the vibrant local scene, with people practicing martial arts and engaging in other unique activities. In the afternoon, head to Mutianyu, the highly acclaimed section of the Great Wall. Despite the approximately 2½-hour drive from downtown Beijing, the breathtaking scenery and meticulously-restored architecture make it a must-visit destination. Admire the picturesque views and create lasting memories at this top-ranked spot on TripAdvisor.

Summer Palace and Train to Xi'an. Marvel at the stunning imperial garden of the Summer Palace, originally the summer retreat of the imperial court and now a peaceful escape from the summer heat. Experience China's technological development as you race towards Xi'an on a high-speed train. This is a unique and exciting way to travel and witness the modern advancements of China's transportation system. Upon arrival, your local guide will meet you and transfer to your hotel. Enjoy the rest of the day at your leisure.

Terracotta Army Museum and Xi'an City Wall. Embark on an intriguing journey by starting your day at the Terracotta Army Museum, unveiling the ancient underground army from 206 BC. Afterwards, immerse yourself in the local culture by joining a craftsman in their cave dwelling to craft your own miniature terracotta warrior. Return to the city center to explore Xi'an City Wall, a 600-year-old fortification that continues to guard the inner city. Enjoy stunning views as you walk along the wall or opt for a bike rental to leisurely cycle around the 14 km perimeter for a unique experience.

Xi‘an City Highlights and Fly to Shanghai. Delve further into Xi'an's captivating history by visiting the Small Wild Goose Pagoda, Xi'an Museum, and Big Wild Goose Pagoda. Afterwards, immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of the Muslim Quarter, explore its winding alleys, and indulge in the diverse local Muslim cuisine. In the afternoon, your guide will accompany you to the airport for your flight to Shanghai. Upon arrival, your Shanghai guide will greet you and transfer you to your hotel, providing an opportunity to relax and rejuvenate for the exciting adventures that await you the following day.

Shanghai City Highlights. Unlock a deeper understanding of the Bund through our immersive In-Depth Bund Culture Discovery Tour, transporting you to the glorious era of the 1920s. Discover the intriguing tales behind the historic buildings that adorn the Bund as you stroll through its nostalgic streets. To capture Shanghai's magnitude, ascend the awe-inspiring Shanghai Tower, China's tallest landmark, offering a mesmerizing panoramic vista of the bustling metropolis. This experience enables you to go beyond ordinary selfies, immersing yourself in the rich cultural heritage of the Bund while witnessing the grandeur of China's largest city.

Depart from Shanghai. Your private car, driver, and guide will be ready at your hotel lobby on the final day, ensuring a punctual departure to the airport. With their impeccable service, you can relax and enjoy a hassle-free experience. They will assist you with check-in procedures and accompany you to the correct security gate, ensuring a smooth and pleasant journey home, leaving you with cherished memories of your time in Japan and China.

tourName: Luxury China tour with Yangtze river cruise
generalInfo: Travel in style on this journey through China to discover its imperial past, modern cities and the majestic landscapes along the meandering Yangtze river. Visit iconic sights including the Great Wall at Jinshanling, the Forbidden City and Summer Palace in Beijing, the Terracotta Warriors in Xian and the Three Gorges of the Yangtze river. Ending in the metropolis of Shanghai, you will learn about life in modern China with visits to local families and rural farming communities and take a private cookery lesson and a street food tour along the way. On this exciting tour, you will be staying at some of the finest hotels in China and cruising aboard the luxurious Sanctuary Yangzi Explorer.

dayInfo.description: On arrival in Beijing, you will be met at the airport by your guide and transferred to your hotel for check-in.

Early this morning, you will begin your discovery of imperial Beijing with a private Tai Chi lesson at the leafy park of the Temple of Heaven, a popular location for locals to gather for their morning exercises. Afterwards, you will take a tour of the temple complex, consisting of religious buildings visited by emperors of the Ming and Qing dynasties to pray to heaven for good harvests. In the afternoon visit the scenic Summer Palace, taking in its lakes, gardens, walkways and teahouses. A masterpiece of Chinese landscape garden design, it is the largest and most well-preserved royal park in Beijing. End the day with a relaxing afternoon tea before returning to your hotel.

This morning journey out of the city to visit the majestic Great Wall. After a two-hour journey, you arrive Jinshanling Pass. This section of Wall is little further out and much quieter, so you'll be able to enjoy the views of the wall snaking off into the distance without the crowds. Take a four-hour walk on the wall with your private guide, looping back through a valley, and enjoy a champagne picnic lunch. After the excursion you will be taken back to Beijing.

Morning visit to the historic Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City with your private guide. Surrounded by the Tiananmen Tower, Monument to the People's Heroes, Great Hall of the People, and Chairman Mao Zedong Memorial Hall, Tiananmen Square is one of the world’s largest and each day, thousands of locals come and pay respects to Chairman Mao’s statue from all over China. Continue to the imperial Forbidden City, a vast site of ancient buildings that was once off limits to all but the emperor and the imperial family. In the afternoon you will take a private cookery lesson and learn to cook some classic Chinese dishes. You’ll sit down to eat your freshly prepared banquet after the class and enjoy chatting about local food and cooking with the chef.

Today you will be taken to Beijing West railway station by private transfer. Take the bullet train to the city of Xian, a five-and-a-half-hour journey. On arrival you're met by a private guide and driver and transferred to your hotel. In the evening, head out to explore Xian's Muslim Quarter on a street food tour. You will sample the delicacies from the many food stalls: the barbecued meat dishes are particularly delicious.

In the morning, you’ll take a tour of the farming villages and caves on the plateau surrounding Xian, driving through rural communities barely touched by the pace of modern China. Enjoy lunch at a local family’s home with a chance to chat with them and gain insight into their lives. Afternoon excursion to the Big Goose Pagoda, built to house Buddhist scriptures brought back from India in 652 AD. End the day with a walk along Xian’s ancient city walls where you can marvel at the sheer scale of the construction as you stroll along the ramparts that provide magnificent views of the city.

This morning explore Xian's star attraction, the Terracotta Army, with your private guide. Even if you have read about these ancient models, nothing can prepare you for their sheer scale and number. Discovered in 1974 by a group of farmers digging a well, it is now one of the main tourist attractions in China and one of the most important archaeological finds of the 20th century. Later you’ll be taken to the airport for a flight to Chongqing. There you will embark on the luxurious Sanctuary Yangzi Explorer cruise to Yichang, setting sail this evening.

You may wish to start your day early with a traditional Tai Chi lesson before a buffet breakfast. For this morning’s shore excursion, you can choose between a visit to an intriguing, secret project, hidden in the mountains of Fuling - The 816 Underground Project or the White Crane Ridge Underwater Project and a local market tour. Return to Sanctuary Yangzi Explorer for a lunch buffet, followed by demonstrations such Chinese foot reflexology and traditional Chinese medicine on board. Learn about beautiful pearls in this afternoon’s lecture, Pearls of the World. This is followed by the Captain’s welcome reception, complete with complimentary canapés.

Today is all about the Three Gorges; Qutang, Wu and Xiling. Through the commentary, discover the myths and facts that make each gorge unique as you pass through them. Experience a unique ride along the Shennong Stream on a sampan - a traditional longboat rowed by expert Tujia boatmen. Before returning to the ship, you will visit a traditional trackers village, where you will have a chance to get a fascinating glimpse of the traditional, rural Chinese community. This evening there is a special farewell dinner, ‘A Taste of China’, followed by Three Gorges Project lecture and a live band performance.

Enjoy a tea or coffee alongside an international buffet breakfast before disembarking in Maoping and visiting the Three Gorges Project Dam Site and Exhibition Centre. Spanning 2,335 metres in length and 181 metres in height, the dam is the largest and most expensive engineering project in the world. After visiting the dam project, you will be transferred to the downtown Yichang for lunch before continuing to the airport. Fly to Shanghai, where you will be met upon arrival by your private guide and driver and taken to your hotel.

In the morning, you will explore the vibrant city of Shanghai by bike. This private cycling tour takes you through the French Concession quarter, with its elegant Art Deco villas, before plunging you into the backstreets and alleyways of off-the-beaten-path residential areas and the maze of narrow streets that make up Shanghai’s old town to see the daily life of local people. You’ll also see the plethora of activities that take place in one of the city’s main public parks and visit a Buddhist temple. The afternoon is at leisure to explore frenetic Shanghai independently. We suggest visiting the Jade Buddha temple, one of the few working monasteries in the city, and the colonial waterfront of the Bund, where you can look across at the ultra-modern skyscrapers of the Pudong district. Fuxing Park is also a pleasant place to wander around, particularly in the morning when locals engage in exercise classes, as are the Yu Gardens. You may also wish to visit the interesting Propaganda Poster Art Centre.
Today you will be taken to the airport by private transfer in time for your return flight.

tourName: Malaysia to Mongolia by train holiday
placesVisited: 24 days across Malaysia, Thailand, Laos, China and Mongolia, the majority of the distance done by rail, travel on the Trans Mongolian railway, tour leader, plus local guides for city tours and stops at local sights, start in Kuala Lumpur, end in Ulaanbaatar
generalInfo:
Travel through epic landscapes on this rail odyssey from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, arriving 23 days later in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. On the way you’ll travel up the Malay Peninsula, passing through Thailand, Laos and China, and spend a day riding on the famous Trans Mongolian railway.

This trip covers an amazing 7,030km using train travel where possible – including overnight trains between Malaysia and Thailand, and Thailand and Laos. There are some great cities on this route, but between them, expect extreme variations of scenery as you move from the tropics north through China. As you head into Mongolia, it's grasslands, then the Gobi Desert.

Lots of travelling is a given, but there’s time off the track to enjoy tours, including the Mekong River, visiting the stone forest karst formations in Yunnan Province, and exploring cities like Bangkok, Vientiane, and Chengdu and Xian in China.

Food is a highlight. As you travel between the cities of the Malay Peninsula, it’s all street food, night markets, and Thai and Malaysian curries. Once you reach China, you’re in Sichuan central, which means amazing Sichuan-pepper infused dishes, then hotpot and barbecue as you approach Mongolia.

Epic trips like this are hard to plan independently. With our experienced team handling all the logistics and tickets, this overland trip becomes not just feasible, but enjoyable too. As well as the carbon-saving nature of rail travel, measures have been taken to ensure this holiday is responsible in other ways – such as avoiding busy areas in peak season, and using small scale, local accommodation and local drivers. You’ll be accompanied throughout by an expert tour leader who will escort you all the way and ensure the whole trip runs smooth– so you can sit back and enjoy the view.

dayInfo.title: Arrive Kuala Lumpur.
dayInfo.description: Start in the bustling city of Kuala Lumpur. Transfer to your hotel before meeting with your Tour Leader and group for a Welcome Meeting and dinner.

dayInfo.title: To Butterworth and Ferry to Penang.
dayInfo.description: This morning we travel from Kuala Lumpur to Butterworth by train before taking the ferry to Georgetown. There is time to relax by the beach before taking in some of the culinary delights of Penang.

dayInfo.title: Penang.
dayInfo.description: Today we visit the UNESCO World Heritage Site of George Town with fascinating street art, temples and wonderful views from Penang Hill.

dayInfo.title: Overnight to Bangkok.
dayInfo.description: We continue our journey up the Malay peninsula through lush tropical forest and plantations to the Thai border at Padang Besar where we join the overnight sleeper service to Bangkok.

dayInfo.title: Arrive Bangkok.
dayInfo.description: With just a short stay in Thailand's colourful & flamboyant capital today our local guide will share some of the classic highlights as well as some less well known aspects of this amazing city. Today we escape the city to explore the calm and cool gardens and private collections of the Prasart Museum.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok.
dayInfo.description: Today we venture to Ayutthaya about 80 kms north of Bangkok. Founded c. 1350, Ayutthaya became the second Siamese capital after Sukhothai. Ayutthaya is now an archaeological ruin, characterized by the remains of tall prang (reliquary towers) and Buddhist monasteries of monumental proportions, which give an idea of the city’s past size and the splendor of its architecture.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok and to Laos.
dayInfo.description: A day in the city visiting Wat Arun, Wat Pho where you will also be treated to a massage before joining our overnight train to Nongkhai and the Laos border.

dayInfo.title: Vientiane.
dayInfo.description: Tree-lined boulevards blend Buddhist temples with French colonial era architecture. Our sightseeing includes the 16th century Pha That Luang. We also visit the imposing Patuxai Victory Monument, commemorating independence from France and often called the 'Arc de Triomphe' of Vientiane. This evening enjoy a sunset stroll along the banks of the Mekong River.

dayInfo.title: Vientiane.
dayInfo.description: A day to further explore Vientiane from the unique Buddha Park with its multitude of Buddhist and Hindu statues, Wat Si Muang and COPE Visitor Centre.

dayInfo.title: To Luang Prabang.
dayInfo.description: This morning we rejoin the train north to the beautiful UNESCO city of Luang Prabang. Today we explore the city taking in views from Phousi Hill, as well as the Ok Pop Tok Living Crafts Centre. Set in lush gardens and located on the banks of the Mekong, the Living Crafts Centre is the perfect place to learn more about the fascinating world of Lao textiles. This afternoon we visit the Kuang Si waterfalls.

dayInfo.title: Luang Prabang.
dayInfo.description: Wake up as the sun rises, we will prepare to join the most sacred tradition of Laos, the daily morning alms giving then visit the temporary morning market. We visit the Royal Palace Museum, Mekong River Cruise to Pak Ou Caves, Ban Xanghai village to observe rice wine, Wat Sene, Wat Xieng Thong, Heuan Chan, Wat Prabath for sunset (weather permitting) and, if interested and time permits, Night Market

dayInfo.title: To Kunming.
dayInfo.description: This morning we board the train for the recently completed 750km rail link from Luang Prabang to Kunming, China. The journey will take us through the incredible scenery of northern Laos and southern Yunnan Province.

dayInfo.title: Kunming.
dayInfo.description: The climate and relaxed ambience of Kunming is perfectly suited to a leisurely walk, and our sightseeing today will take us through the old alleys to Cuihu Park, with its many bridges and pagodas, and nearby the Yuantong Buddhist Temple.

dayInfo.title: Kunming.
dayInfo.description: Beyond the city we visit the enchanting 'Stone Forest' - these unusual and unique karst stone formations are a highlight of Yunnan Province.

dayInfo.title: To Chengdu.
dayInfo.description: Back aboard the train enjoy some stunning scenery as we travel to Chengdu (Sichuan Province) famous spicy food.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu.
dayInfo.description: This morning we enjoy a tour of the city. The afternoon is at leisure allowing time for you to visit other sites such as the panda research base should you wish to do so. Sichuan cuisine is renowned in China and internationally, we sample some of its classic dishes this evening before boarding the overnight train to Xining, Qinghai Province - high on the Tibetan Plateau (2275m).

dayInfo.title: Chengdu to Xian.
dayInfo.description: A high speed train takes us to Xian, ancient Chang'an. Once this was the glittering capital of Cathay. Old pagodas, city walls and watchtowers remain. We explore the city to see the Small Wild Goose Pagoda, Grand Mosque, walk the Muslim quarter and the food streets.

dayInfo.title: Xian.
dayInfo.description: The city still captures the romance of its rich imperial past and the glories of the Silk Road. There is so much to explore in this city, the Big Wild Goose Pagoda, and the Shaanxi History Museum being some of the highlights. NB: For journeys operating outside of July and August we will be including a tour of the Terracotta Warriors. In July and August free time will be available should you wish to arrange a visit there. Our experience is that it is incredibly crowded during those months and therefore it is not included at that time.

dayInfo.title: Xian.
dayInfo.description: We have more time today to perhaps walk the city walls or wander the laneways of Xian.

dayInfo.title: To Hohhot.
dayInfo.description: We journey north to Hohhot, the capital city of Inner Mongolia in China, offers a unique blend of Mongolian culture, history, and natural beauty. We arrive by train in the evening.

dayInfo.title: Trans Mongolian Railway.
dayInfo.description: We spend the day exploring Hohhot famous for its contrasting bustling markets and open grasslands. We enjoy some hot pot before joining the evening train that will take us onwards towards Mongolia.

dayInfo.title: Trans Mongolian Railway.
dayInfo.description: Our train rumbles along the Trans Mongolian Railway. The villages and fields of northern China slip away as we head north. As the sun sets we’ll cross the Gobi Desert bound for the Mongolian border and its quirky yet friendly capital of Ulaanbaatar.

dayInfo.title: Arrive Ulaanbaatar and to Terelj.
dayInfo.description: We arrive in the morning into the capital and we travel out across the grasslands, through the countryside that was once the home to Genghis Khan and his Golden Horde, to the pristine Terelj National Park for a night stay in a ger – the traditional home of the Mongolian people.

dayInfo.title: To Ulaanbaatar - Tour Concludes.
dayInfo.description: This morning we return to the city via the giant statue to Genghis Khan. We then bid farewell after an epic adventure with tales to tell on our return home.

tourName: Malaysia to Nepal overland adventure
generalInfo: Embark on an extraordinary overland adventure tracing the heart of Asia—from the modern skylines of Kuala Lumpur to the sacred peaks of the Himalayas. This 28 day journey weaves through vibrant cities, ancient capitals, and breathtaking landscapes, offering a rare glimpse into the cultural and geographical diversity of Southeast and Central Asia. Experience the dynamic charm of Bangkok, the serene spirituality of Laos, and the timeless beauty of Yunnan’s mountain towns before ascending to the high plateaus of Tibet. From the mystical city of Lhasa to the world’s rooftop at Everest Base Camp, every stop reveals stories of tradition, resilience, and wonder. The journey culminates in Kathmandu, where Himalayan grandeur meets rich cultural heritage, marking the perfect finale to an unforgettable exploration across borders, cultures, and altitudes—a true odyssey through the soul of Asia.

dayInfo.title: Arrive Kuala Lumpur.
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Malaysia’s dazzling capital! Upon arrival in Kuala Lumpur, settle into your hotel and take time to unwind after your flight. This afternoon we will hold our Welcome Meeting with your Tour Leader before dinner. This evening, stroll through lively streets lined with food stalls and modern skyscrapers. The Petronas Twin Towers illuminate the skyline, symbolising the vibrant energy of Southeast Asia’s gateway city. Rest well before the journey ahead.

dayInfo.title: Kuala Lumpur to Penang.
dayInfo.description: We depart Kuala Lumpur by train for Butterworth, travelling through lush Malaysian countryside dotted with tropical villages and palm plantations. From Butterworth, take a scenic ferry across to Penang Island, known as the “Pearl of the Orient.” On arrival, explore the historic streets of George Town, a UNESCO World Heritage site rich in colonial charm, colourful murals, and aromatic street food.

dayInfo.title: Penang.
dayInfo.description: Spend the day uncovering Penang’s captivating blend of heritage and culture. Wander through the narrow lanes of George Town, where ornate temples, British-era buildings, and vibrant street art coexist harmoniously. Visit Kek Lok Si Temple, Malaysia’s largest Buddhist temple, and enjoy panoramic views from Penang Hill. As evening falls, indulge in Penang’s famous hawker fare — a delicious reflection of its multicultural soul.

dayInfo.title: To Bangkok.
dayInfo.description: Return to Butterworth Station to board the international train bound for Bangkok. The journey takes you across the Malaysian–Thai border at Padang Besar, revealing a changing landscape of emerald fields and tranquil villages. Relax in your carriage and enjoy the gentle rhythm of overnight rail travel as you make your way toward Thailand’s vibrant capital.

dayInfo.title: Arrive Bangkok.
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the buzz of Bangkok, Thailand’s dynamic capital. After arriving in the morning, transfer to your hotel and refresh before exploring the city’s highlights. Discover the shimmering Grand Palace, home to the revered Emerald Buddha, and the serene Wat Pho, where the Reclining Buddha rests in golden splendour. Drift along the Chao Phraya River on a longtail boat, glimpsing everyday life along its banks. As evening falls, sample authentic Thai cuisine amid the city’s lively night markets and neon-lit streets.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok and to Laos.
dayInfo.description: Spend a final morning in Bangkok where we visit Wat Pho and Wat Arun in the city before departing on the overnight journey to Laos. As the train winds northward, watch the landscapes transform from bustling urban sprawl to peaceful countryside. Relax onboard and reflect on the journey so far, as you cross into a new country rich with spiritual charm and tranquil beauty. Overnight on the train, lulled by the rhythm of Southeast Asia’s rails.

dayInfo.title: Arrive Vientiane.
dayInfo.description: Arrive in Vientiane and check into your hotel. Begin your exploration with a city tour including Wat Si Saket, home to thousands of Buddha images. Visit the historic Haw Phra Kaew, then marvel at the grand Patuxai Victory Monument. Stroll along the Mekong River promenade, enjoy local cuisine at a riverside café, and relax as the city comes alive at sunset.

dayInfo.title: Vientiane.
dayInfo.description: Discover Vientiane’s treasures on a full-day tour. Visit Patuxai and That Luang Stupa, iconic national landmarks, followed by the whimsical Buddha Park with its Buddhist and Hindu statues. Stop at Wat Si Muang for spiritual insight and the COPE Visitor Centre to learn about humanitarian efforts.

dayInfo.title: To Luang Prabang.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, we take a train to Luang Prabang. Explore the UNESCO-listed old town, including Wat Xieng Thong, and enjoy the charm of streets lined with colonial architecture and local shops. Known for its relaxed ambience, soak in the views of the river and the laidback feel of the town.

dayInfo.title: Luang Prabang.
dayInfo.description: Visit the Royal Palace Museum to explore Laos’ royal heritage. Take a Mekong River cruise to Pak Ou Caves, then stop at Ban Xanghai village to witness local traditions. Explore Wat Sene and Wat Xieng Thong, then stroll through Heuan Chan. Conclude the day at Wat Prabath for a stunning sunset, weather permitting, capturing panoramic views of the Mekong and surrounding town.

dayInfo.title: To Jinghong.
dayInfo.description: Today we take a morning train to Jinghong, China, the heart of Yunnan’s Dai culture. Explore the bustling local markets, temples, and riverside streets. Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere, sampling Dai cuisine and experiencing traditional customs. Take in the lush tropical surroundings and the colorful architecture, reflecting a rich cultural blend. Enjoy a relaxed evening in Jinghong, preparing for your journey to Pu’er tomorrow.

dayInfo.title: To Pu'er.
dayInfo.description: Travel to Pu’er, renowned for its tea plantations. Tour local tea estates and learn about the intricate tea-making process. Explore scenic countryside views, rolling hills, and lush plantations. Sample a variety of Pu’er teas and visit local markets to experience regional culture. End the day relaxing and soaking in the tranquil landscapes that make this region a tea lover’s paradise.

dayInfo.title: Pu'er and to Kunming.
dayInfo.description: Spend the morning exploring Pu’er’s highlights, including tea plantations and local historic sites. Interact with locals to understand traditional tea practices. In the afternoon, board a 3-hour train to Kunming, enjoying scenic views of Yunnan’s diverse landscapes. Upon arrival, explore Kunming’s vibrant night markets and taste local specialties, soaking in the lively atmosphere of this southwestern Chinese city.

dayInfo.title: To Dali.
dayInfo.description: Take a 2-hour train to Dali, a picturesque town by Erhai Lake. Visit the Three Pagodas and explore the charming Old Town with its cobblestone streets and Bai architecture. Stroll along the lakeside, enjoy panoramic mountain views, and experience local life. Shop for traditional handicrafts and savor Bai cuisine at local eateries, then relax for an evening immersed in Dali’s tranquil charm.

dayInfo.title: To Kunming.
dayInfo.description: Return to Kunming by train, enjoying the scenic Yunnan countryside. Explore city highlights. Visit historic temples and taste regional delicacies such as “crossing-the-bridge” noodles. Immerse yourself in the unique mix of modern life and traditional culture, capturing vibrant cityscapes and enjoying a relaxed evening in preparation for tomorrow’s excursion.

dayInfo.title: Kunming and to Xining.
dayInfo.description: Beyond the city we visit the enchanting 'Stone Forest', a UNESCO World Heritage site with dramatic limestone formations. Explore the natural labyrinths and learn about Sani culture. Return to Kunming to board the night train to Xining. Settle in for an overnight journey across China’s diverse landscapes, resting as you traverse toward the Tibetan Plateau for the next stage of your adventure.

dayInfo.title: Xining.
dayInfo.description: Arrive late in Xining, the gateway to Tibet.

dayInfo.title: Xining and to Lhasa.
dayInfo.description: This morning we visit Ta’er Monastery, an important Tibetan Buddhist site. We board the Qinghai-Tibet Railway, one of the world’s highest railways, crossing stunning plateaus, snow-capped mountains, and crystal-clear lakes. Learn about Tibetan culture from guides and fellow travelers. Arrive in Lhasa, the spiritual heart of Tibet, ready to explore iconic landmarks such as the Potala Palace.

dayInfo.title: Arriva Lhasa.
dayInfo.description: We arrive in Lhasa this morning, where your local guide will warmly welcome you to the Roof of the World. Transfer to your hotel and spend the afternoon at leisure, allowing your body to gently adjust to the high altitude. Take a relaxed stroll along the bustling Barkhor Street, encircling the sacred Jokhang Temple, where the scent of incense and murmured prayers fill the crisp Himalayan air.

dayInfo.title: Lhasa.
dayInfo.description: Immerse yourself in the grandeur of Tibet’s spiritual heart. Visit the majestic Potala Palace, once home to the Dalai Lamas, followed by the serene Norbulingka Palace, the traditional summer residence. In the afternoon, explore Drepung Monastery, one of Tibet’s largest and most influential monastic institutions, offering panoramic views over Lhasa.

dayInfo.title: Lhasa.
dayInfo.description: Begin your day at the revered Jokhang Temple, Tibet’s most sacred site and a timeless centre of devotion. Continue to Sera Monastery, renowned for its lively monastic debates — a fascinating insight into Tibetan scholastic tradition. The day offers a deeper connection to Tibet’s spiritual rhythm and monastic life.

dayInfo.title: To Gyantse.
dayInfo.description: Embark on a breathtaking drive across the Tibetan Plateau, passing the turquoise waters of Yamdrok Tso Lake and the glistening Aruola Glacier. Arrive in Gyantse, where history and spirituality intertwine. Visit the ancient Dzong Fortress and the exquisite Palcho Monastery, famed for its multi-tiered Kumbum stupa. Overnight in Gyantse after an inspiring 270 km journey through Tibet’s dramatic landscapes.

dayInfo.title: To Shigatse.
dayInfo.description: Travel to Shigatse, Tibet’s second-largest city, to explore the grand Tashilhunpo Monastery, the seat of the Panchen Lama. Continue to the remote village of Sajia to visit the remarkable Sajia Temple, known for its medieval murals and monastic treasures. Overnight in Sajia after a scenic 240 km drive filled with history and Himalayan vistas.

dayInfo.title: To Everest Base Camp.
dayInfo.description: Journey through rugged mountain terrain to reach Rongbuk, the world’s highest monastery, set against the backdrop of Mount Everest. Visit the Rongbuk Temple and continue to Everest Base Camp, where the world’s greatest peak rises before you in all its glory. Spend the night in a local guesthouse in Rongbuk, beneath a canopy of stars at 5,000 metres.

dayInfo.title: To Jilong.
dayInfo.description: Depart Rongbuk and travel via Gangga to Jilong, descending gradually from the high plateau into lush Himalayan valleys. The journey reveals a changing landscape—from barren peaks to green forests—showcasing the dramatic contrasts of Tibet. Overnight in the peaceful border town of Jilong after an epic 285 km drive.

dayInfo.title: To Kathmandu.
dayInfo.description: After completing border formalities, cross into Nepal, where your Himalayan adventure continues. The scenery transforms once again, with the rugged Tibetan plateau giving way to the verdant foothills of Nepal. Welcome to a new chapter of cultural discovery and natural wonder.

dayInfo.title: Kathmandu and Tour concludes.
dayInfo.description: We then bid farewell after an epic adventure with tales to tell on our return home.

tourName: North to South Silk Road expedition holiday, China
generalInfo:
This 16-day epic is the definitive Xinjiang experience, bridging the lush alpine forests of the North with the rich Islamic culture and deserts of the South.

Why choose this holiday?

A Tale of Two Worlds: Witness the stark contrast between the Siberian-like landscapes of Kanas and the Middle Eastern atmosphere of Kashgar. This trip covers the geographic and cultural spectrum of Central Asia.

The Pamir Plateau: We venture high into the Pamirs to Tashkurgan, driving the Karakoram Highway to see the majestic Muztagh Ata peak and meet the Tajik people.

Humanitarian Connection: This trip includes a visit to a local social welfare initiative where we donate a portion of proceeds to support minority education, making your presence a force for good.

Authentic Crafts: In the Old Towns of the south, we visit master craftsmen of pottery and instruments, avoiding tourist traps to see the real living heritage.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN URUMQI. Welcome to the gateway of Central Asia. Meet your dedicated team and transfer to your hotel to rest.
DESERT CROSSING TO ALTAY. Drive the new S21 Desert Highway through the Gurbantunggut Desert. Spot wild camels before arriving in Altay.
HEMU VILLAGE ARRIVAL. Travel the scenic "A-He Highway" through the Altai Mountains. Arrive in the fairy-tale wooden village of Hemu.
KANAS NATURE RESERVE. Visit the famous bays of Kanas Lake and the border village of Baihaba ("Village No.1"). Stay in a traditional log cabin.
THE BORDER HIGHWAY. Drive along the legendary G219 border highway to Urho, enjoying world-class views of the frontier landscapes.
GHOST CITY TO SAYRAM. Explore the wind-eroded "World Devil City" yardangs. Drive to Sayram Lake for a sunset lakeside walk.
DUSHANZI CANYON. Morning sailing on Sayram Lake. Travel to the start of the Duku Highway to visit the dramatic Dushanzi Grand Canyon.
DUKU HIGHWAY (NORTH). Traverse the snow-capped peaks of the northern Duku Highway to the Nalati "Sky Grassland."
BAYINBULUKE SUNSET. Explore Nalati's forests. Continue to Bayinbuluke to witness the legendary "Nine Suns" sunset at the winding river.
MYSTERIOUS GRAND CANYON. Drive the southern Duku past alpine lakes to Kuqa. Hike the red sandstone Tianshan Mysterious Grand Canyon.
KIZIL CAVES TO AKSU. Visit the ancient Kizil Thousand Buddha Caves, the cradle of Buddhism in China, before arriving in Aksu.
ARRIVAL IN KASHGAR. Enter the soul of the Silk Road. Enjoy an exclusive rooftop photoshoot and evening walk in the Old City.
THE KARAKORAM HIGHWAY. Ascend the Pamir Plateau. Visit White Sand Lake and Karakul Lake under the gaze of Muztagh Ata peak.
THE NATIONAL GATE. Journey to the Khunjerab Pass (world's highest border crossing) and visit a local Tajik family home.
PANLONG ANCIENT ROAD. Conquer the famous Panlong Road with its 600+ hairpin turns and view the Oytagh Glacier Park before returning to Kashgar.
DEPARTURE. Transfer to Kashgar airport for your onward flight. Farewell to the Silk Road.

tourName: Northern Xinjiang 7 day tour in China
generalInfo:
This 7-day compact expedition offers a stunning introduction to Northern Xinjiang’s "Sky Road." Starting from Urumqi, you will venture deep into the Tianshan Mountains, witnessing the geological miracle of the Duku Highway—a road that traverses four seasons in a single day.

Why choose this holiday?

The Highway of Legends: We prioritize your safety and experience on the Duku Highway. Unlike standard bus tours, our small-group format allows for flexible stops at hidden viewpoints like the "Dragon’s Back" of the Tianshan, ensuring you capture the landscape's raw beauty without the crowds.

Nomadic Encounters: You won't just see yurts from a distance; you will be welcomed into the summer pastures of local Kazakh families near Narat Grassland. Share a bowl of fresh milk tea, learn about their eagle-hunting heritage, and understand how they have coexisted with these mountains for centuries.

Glacial Serenity: From the sapphire waters of Heavenly Lake to the "Atlantic's Last Tear"—Sayram Lake, we allocate ample time for lakeside introspection, moving beyond the touch-and-go style of mass tourism.

Inclusive Dining: Whether you are vegan, vegetarian, or require Halal options, our local guides are experts in navigating Xinjiang’s meat-heavy cuisine to provide diverse, plant-based delights using fresh, locally sourced ingredients.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN URUMQI. Welcome to the gateway of Central Asia. Private transfer to your hotel. Evening exploration of the Grand Bazaar.
URUMQI TO KUYTUN. Explore the "Pearl of the Tianshan," Heavenly Lake, followed by a drive to the Grand Canyon of the Duku Highway system.
DUKU HIGHWAY TRAVERSAL. A spectacular drive crossing snow-capped peaks to the endless Bayinbuluke Grassland (Note: Seasonal road).
NARAT GRASSLAND EXPERIENCE. Immerse yourself in the "Sky Grassland," visiting local Kazakh families and enjoying the alpine scenery.
SAYRAM LAKE IMMERSION. Drive to the breathtaking Sayram Lake. Cycle or hike along the shores of the highest alpine lake in Xinjiang.
RETURN TO URUMQI. Visit the International Grand Bazaar for final cultural insights and souvenir shopping.
DEPARTURE FROM URUMQI. Private transfer to the airport for your onward journey.

tourName: Northern Xinjiang cultural holiday in China
generalInfo:
This 10-day journey expands your horizon to the pristine Altai Mountains in the far north before descending to the central Tianshan range. It is the ultimate combination of forest tranquility and highway adventure.

Why choose this holiday?

Tribal Hospitality: Experience the rare culture of the Tuvan people. We stay in authentic, renovated wooden cabins in Hemu Village, allowing you to wake up to the morning mist and the smell of baking bread, far removed from commercial hotels.

Slow Travel Philosophy: We reject the "rush hour" style of travel. In Kanas and Hemu, we dedicate full days to hiking and photography, allowing you to connect with the rhythm of nature.

The Full Duku Experience: We drive the entire northern section of the Duku Highway, stopping at the Tangbula "Hundred Mile Gallery" for a picnic that features local, organic produce.

Cultural Souvenirs: We present each guest with a unique piece of Xinjiang’s intangible cultural heritage as a farewell gift, supporting the specific artisans we visit during the trip.

dayInfo.description: WELCOME TO URUMQI. Meet your local Uyghur guide and transfer to your hotel. Introduction to the Silk Road history.
ACROSS THE DESERT. Drive through the Gurbantunggut Desert, witnessing the transition from dunes to the Altai foothills.
HEMU VILLAGE ARRIVAL. Enter the fairy-tale village of Hemu. Stay in a traditional Tuvan wooden log cabin.
HEMU SUNRISE & HIKING. Early morning photography of the mist. Gentle hiking around the village to meet local artisans.
KANAS LAKE NATURE RESERVE. Travel to Kanas Lake. Visit the Guanyu Pavilion for panoramic views of the "Loch Ness" of China.
THE RAINBOW BEACH. Descend to Burqin to visit the multi-colored yardang landforms at sunset.
SAYRAM LAKE LOOP. A scenic drive to the crystal-clear Sayram Lake via the Guozigou Bridge.
TANGULA & DUKU HIGHWAY. Enter the Tianshan range, experiencing the dramatic landscapes of the Duku Highway.
RETURN TO URUMQI. Complete the loop with a drive through the "Hundred Mile Gallery" back to the capital.
FAREWELL. Transfer to the airport, taking memories of the Altai and Tianshan with you.

tourName: Pandas and Yangtze river family tour, China
generalInfo:
Explore Beijing and Shanghai's Historic Wonders, Connect with a Local Family in a Traditional Hutong, and Delight in Pandas at the Breeding Base. Unwind on a Scenic Yangtze River Cruise, Perfecting Your Family's Memorable Escape.

Tour Highlights
Great Wall Trekking Adventure: Embark on an unforgettable hike along the majestic Great Wall of China, stepping through history and breathtaking scenery.

Dumpling Delight with a Local Family: Be warmly invited into a Chinese household, where you'll share in the joyful of making and feasting on traditional dumplings.

Beijing Roast Duck: Savor the culinary delight that is authentic Beijing Roast Duck, a dinner experience rich in flavor and tradition.

Panda Encounter at the Conservation Center: Get up close and personal with the adorable pandas at a premier breeding and research center, witnessing conservation in action.

Yangtze River Cruise Serenity: Relax and revel in the stunning landscapes during a leisurely cruise down the Yangtze, China's majestic waterway.

Sky High Thrills at Shanghai's Glass Walk: Brave the heights at Shanghai's tallest building, stepping out onto a thrilling glass sky deck for a panoramic view that tests your limits and rewards with unforgettable vistas.

Trip Notes
1. Tailoring your tour.
This tour is very flexible. You can alter the itinerary, extend or shorten it to suit your price, interest and schedule. Feel free to tell us your requirements, and we are happy to help you arrange with our professional knowledge and experience.

2. Hotel
Most hotels in China allow at most three people in one room. If there are more than three people in your group, we will check if there is family room available or do our best to arrange interconnecting rooms or adjoin rooms.

3. Food
Lunches at popular local restaurants are included for you. Your guide will assist you with ordering dishes loved by both adults and children. Most families enjoy eating local Chinese food as there is plenty of variety and different flavors, and the food is so much better and different from the Chinese food served back home. Some children may prefer Western food or have some special requirements for meals. Please inform us and we will do our best to cater to your needs

4. Car Seats, Stroller, and Baby Crib
To maximize the safety of your children, we can arrange for car seats to be fitted at your request during the private transfers in Beijing, Shanghai, Chengdu, . For a baby under two years old, we will inform the hotel to arrange a crib for you. No extra cost is needed. The number of car seats, strollers, and cribs are limited. Please inquire and confirm early to reserve them.

5. First Aid Kit
We all know how active kids can be. In case of some small injury, our guides will take a first aid kit with them during the tour, including alcohol prep pads, sterile gauze sponges, and bandages.
