Begin in the quaint Central Street: a former hub for residents from countries all over the world, it boasts a variety of stunning age-old European architecture. Cobblestone walkways are decorated in snow while a predominant Russian theme fills its shops, restaurants and bars. Indulge in Russian, French, British and German-made goods including traditional dolls, perfumes, wools, medicines and much more. Dating back to 1898, this area is a corridor of architectural magic and is a must-visit attraction of Harbin. As early evening approaches, make your way to the unforgettably wondrous St. Sophia Cathedral and city square. This stunning Russian-style construction displays magical snow-drizzled domes and spires with enchanting Roman features. Night falls and upward lights create a magical bronze glow across the architectural masterpiece – forming a spectacular scene against the coats of winter white. Harbin’s open city square encircles the cathedral, and on its perimeter lay a range of beautiful backlit buildings. Next, head to the Jile Temple, otherwise known as the Temple of Bliss. Consisting of 10 different structures, including halls, towers and cells, it is the largest Buddhist complex in Heilongjiang Province. Its focal point is a glorious seven-story pagoda standing over 30 meters tall, decorated with detailed Buddhist pictures. You will witness stunning colored brickwork and golden Buddha statues amid the winter’s white delights as you walk among peaceful courtyards where burning incense gently set sail strings of smoke into the air. Admire the wonderfully traditional stone and bronze architecture both in and outside of the halls. Later that evening enjoy another customary local taste of cuisine as you tickle your taste buds with a delicious Dongbei Hotpot dinner.

dayInfo.title: Harbin – Sun Island Snow Sculpture Art Expo and Siberian Tiger Park
dayInfo.description: It’s morning, and time to prepare for a day featuring a wide range of wonders, beginning with a trip to the beautiful Sun Island - sitting amid the serene Songhua River. It is a winter haven: witness the astounding works of art on display at the International Snow Sculpture Expo – stunningly detailed and equally as impressive in size, these snow and ice sculptures are simply awe-inspiring and will leave you with a longing sense of disbelief. Sledding, skating and skiing activities play out around the park as you walk amid this winter wonderland, and you can get involved in these activities if you wish. See spotted deer stroll among the thick powders of snow; beautiful pavilions; picturesque Russian architecture and so much more in this unique and spectacular area. Journey toward the nearby Siberian Tiger Park, and witness one of the world’s endangered species. This huge area displays stunning young, matured and king tigers living a free, natural life amid beautiful snow-filled fields. A heavily protected vehicle will take you to within meters of these spectacular creatures, and there will also be opportunity to see panoramic views from the walking zone and observing platform. For those who are at one with wildlife and nature: pay a small fee to witness fascinating action as the tigers hunt down their pray. After a spot of lunch head to the Heilongjiang Provincial Museum – the largest museum in Heilongjiang. Another building representing Russian-style architecture, it displays relics that offer a fascinating insight into past disputes over who ruled the region. The museum is separated by three halls: in the first you’ll see insightful artifacts from tribes and countries that conquered and ruled the northern part of China. The second displays information and fossils of animals that resided/reside in the area; and the third exhibits extinct animals - including captivating dinosaur fossils. Take a trip back to the hotel and spend the evening however you wish. After recharging your batteries you may want to head out and partake in some extra exploring!

dayInfo.title: Harbin – Tour of Stalin Park and Ice Lantern Festival Show
dayInfo.description: This morning make your way to another park situated amid the Songhua River: Stalin Park. This beautiful area is another winter haven; its focal point is the Flood Control Monument - commemorating the residents of Harbin whom miraculously controlled a colossal flood of the city back in 1957. The statue is of traditional European-style design, and looks glorious amid its floral surroundings. But it’s during the winter months, when the lake is thickly glazed with ice, that the park comes to life. Winter sports and games take place: skilled skaters jump and twist their way around, stunning Husky dogs run freely and tow sleds in their wintery wake, all while local musicians treat you to some delightful tunes. Experience extraordinary views over the city this afternoon as you head to the peak of the Dragon Tower. Aside from its practical significance as a key TV pylon of Heilongjiang Province, it is the tallest steel tower in Asia and possesses structural beauty. A thick base smoothly narrows to a circular viewing platform, before its slim peak that sits high in the sky. You’ll enjoy the wondrous winter views of the city’s architecture and natural splendor from the observation deck – a fitting way to spend some of your final hours of the trip. Your stomach will be longing for some food, so head back to the hotel for a bite to eat before spending the night in spectacular fashion as you enjoy the unforgettable Ice Lantern Show at Zhaolin Park. The serene snow-topped peaks of Huageo Mountain and Meigui Mountain beautifully peer over the park as you admire colorful lights bringing to life snow and ice sculptures that replicate famous buildings, ancient legends, and famed icons. You’ll gaze in wonder at these works of art, which depict detail and size that defies logic. Shades of red, green, blue, purple and pink reflect all around, igniting a sense of serenity and cultural insight – leaving there no better place to conclude your stay in Harbin.

dayInfo.title: Harbin – Departure
dayInfo.description: Enjoy your final breakfast in this wonderful city, before spending the morning however you wish. Perhaps get one last glimpse of those spectacular ice sculptures and the city’s stunning architecture – or maybe purchase those last-minute gifts for family and friends. Leave for the airport late morning, and take one more look at this beautiful city during your private transfer – reigniting those unforgettable winter memories you’ve made in both Harbin and Beijing.

tourName: Luxury Highlights of China & Japan Tour
placesVisited: Beijing, Xian, Shanghai, Osaka, Mount Koya, Kyoto, Arashiyama, Kanazawa, Tokyo, Roppongi, Takayama
generalInfo: Samurai residences and Kyoto gardens, the Great Wall and the Terracotta Army are all yours to explore on this incredible journey. From kaiseki in a ryokan to Michelin Shanghai dining, this itinerary will bring 12 nights of new experiences in the best of luxury China and Japan. Travel through 3,000 years of tradition and then into tomorrow’s world on a handcrafted tour that goes far beyond the usual tourist sights in Beijing, Xian, Zhujiajiao, Shanghai, Mount Koya, Kyoto, Takayama, Kanazawa, and Tokyo.

dayInfo.title: Beijing – Handpicked Dining in a Contemporary City
dayInfo.description: Beijing brings many things to every visitor, a vast contemporary city with a historical heart and a bustling sense of possibility. Neon flashes as dusk arrives and the roads are crowded with both people and vehicles going about their evening. Even from high up in a skyscraper, you can sense all the energy down below. Your restaurant for tonight stands above the city, a postmodern setting looking down on an imperial city center. Tomorrow, you will dive into what makes Beijing tick, but this evening is about downtime so that you can sit back and gaze on it all from on high as you dine. The cuisine is contemporary, with handpicked recipes from across the country given a chic makeover by one of the country’s most regarded up-and-coming chefs.

dayInfo.title: Beijing – Antiques, Architecture, Forbidden and Formidable
dayInfo.description: What remains of Beijing imperial city suggests a world unfazed by time. The Forbidden City is the central masterpiece, majestic in scale, and quite formidable when witnessed for the first time. It is a starting point to understanding the rest, like the Temple of Heaven, an icon so sublime that even the emperors would come to bow their heads before it. From here, you will dive down into the hutongs, the mazy little alleys where tea sellers roam and the clinking of glasses meets the hum of chatter. Very few hutongs remain, yet the atmosphere remains timeless, especially as you stop for a tea and watch the world roll by. From here, you can visit two markets. Panjiayuan is a place of antiques with forgotten trinkets gathering dust and occasionally catching the eye. More items get sold in Hongqiao, the hustle and bustle of traditional trade leaving an impression on the ears as well as the eyes. As you tour Beijing alongside your private guide, there is also a stop in Tiananmen Square, another major symbol from world history. Complete your first full day with Peking duck, a classic dish made contemporary in another of the city’s excellent restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Beijing – Great Wall of China with Helicopter Panorama
dayInfo.description: The Great Wall of China cascades onwards, and onwards. Rolling over the hills, it never seems to end with over 10,000 miles of stone blocks in various states of ruin and preservation. To appreciate this monumental feat you must take to the air, this being one of the only manmade structures visible from space. From your helicopter, you can loop above the wall and watch how it stretches through the thick forest and just keeps moving onwards. Touch down in a relatively remote place, where the silence means you hear your own footsteps along the wall, and then fly back to the best-preserved section, which is incredibly busy with tourists and makes you feel glad of the earlier off-the-track experience. Return to Beijing and your afternoon can be customized, perhaps heading into a modern city, or maybe focusing on a blossoming art scene.

dayInfo.title: Xian – All the Legends and an Intimate Old-World Cooking Experience
dayInfo.description: Fly to Xian to step much further back in time, going back over a millennia before the wall was dreamed up. Dynasties flourished here, creating a city that formed one end of the Great Silk Road. That legacy is best understood as you walk or cycle the city walls and can look down on small quarters, and across at rising pagodas as your guide narrates the tales of what took place in the time of the Ming and Tang. Explore this Middle Kingdom city and then find an army fit for an emperor as the life-sized terracotta warriors are each with their own expressions and details. You will see the archaeological site before gaining exclusive access to the Tang dynasty murals, art pieces that shed light on why these figures were buried beneath the ground. They are some of ancient China’s most resplendent art pieces and are usually closed to the public.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai – The Venice of the East and Superlative Michelin-Starred Dining
dayInfo.description: Fly from ancient Shaanxi province to bustling and somewhat futuristic Shanghai. It will be an early flight, and you will head straight from the city to Zhujiajiao. They call it the Venice of the East, even though its age and history means it is likely more appropriate to call Venice the Zhujiajiao of the West. Spice stalls line the waterways, rice stores are in a state of harmonic disintegration, and the cobbled bridges are a dream for photographers. Following the mazy waterways you discover old, untouched China, and then back in Shanghai, you can jump back into the country’s future. Flashing neon displays, a skyline illuminated all night, and a restaurant run by a triple Michelin-starred chef is yours to take in, including dinner that includes 22 courses of Chinese delicacies, degustation in a gloriously opulent setting high above Shanghai.

dayInfo.title: Mount Koya – A Rich Contrast in Cultures: Chinese City to Japanese Mountain Monastery
dayInfo.description: If you are up early, you can take the time to catch old Shanghai coming to life, especially the remains of what used to be the international quarter. You will fly to Osaka just after midday, and from there it is a 90-minute transfer to Mount Koya. What contrast you find as high in the mountains, hidden from the world, lives a community of Shingon Buddhist monks. Residents guide you around the monastery and temple in their orange robes, teaching key elements of their Zen approach. You can eat with them, listen to their euphonic nighttime prayers, and then spend the night in a 12th-century temple. After six days in China, it will be a perfect place to unwind and reset both your body and your mind as the simplicity of the building helps to prepare you for another week of travel.

dayInfo.title: Kyoto – Spirituality and Spirit Messages
dayInfo.description: Early mornings are so special in Japanese temples as the fresh air rolls off of the mountains, the rhythmic chant of prayers fills the space and the rituals create connection through silence. Local nuns can take you on a walk to the 200,000 tombstones of Okunoin Cemetery before a Kyoto guide leads your journey by road to Japan’s cultural center. This is a city almost with too many temples, and you will find them in the bamboo forest, uncover them behind fragrant gardens, spot them on hilltops, and amid modern streets. Each is its own symbol of purity, and an illustration of the era in which it was constructed. The gold leaf of Kinkaku-Ji, the call of spirits at Fushimi Inari, pristine gardens, and bamboo forest around Tenyuji. Follow the spiritual trail, and by this evening, you will be fully wrapped in the old Japanese experience.

dayInfo.title: Kyoto – Behind the Scenes Private Tour Through Hidden Kyoto
dayInfo.description: More than 2,000 temples and shrines cover Kyoto, and there are both the famous and the unknown. And then there are the mysteries, which will form the focus of your private tour today. Mossy foliage guards the secluded Honen-in, an ode to a 17th-century priest while the Rinzai sect provides a history to Nanzen-Ji. Some temples are not open to the public, but your guide gains access. Many of the gardens are also closed, and once again, your guide will be able to unlock the doors for private viewings. It will be easy to spend Kyoto time charging around famous sites, but today’s tour is all about those stories left behind, some of them verbal, many of them expressions of artistry.

dayInfo.title: Takayama – Immersed in the Edo Period and Hida Beef
dayInfo.description: Wooden houses line the narrow streets of Takayama, Edo period homes that have been expertly preserved. It’s quiet here, like Kyoto and Mount Koya, just in a different way. Footsteps echo on elaborate bridges; chatter escapes from antique stores; fables are found in Sanmachi Suji. You’re staying in a ryokan, traditional accommodation of tatami mats, futon beds, and chabudai dining tables. On the table comes a meal from history. Hida beef is the most revered of all Japanese wagyu beef, the muscle, and marbling creating juiciness that’s always placed above Kobe beef for local consumers. Enjoy some beef sushi before classic sukiyaki adorns the table and you indulge in this Japanese style of hot pot.

dayInfo.title: Kanazawa – A Second Ryokan, Samurai Residences and Kaiseki Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Kanazawa is just as old-world and traditional as you settle into a second ryokan experience. Rather than merchant houses, the town is covered with teahouses and Samurai residences. Other legends live here as well, and you will take a stroll through the geisha district. Kanazawa is mysterious, and that is its real beauty, this world that you can grasp yet you cannot ever quite understand. Imagine Samurai tales of desire and dignity, one of the world’s best sushi restaurants for lunch, gardens, and castles, and an afternoon with a geisha. There is a lot to take in, so you can dine in private this evening with superb kaiseki cuisine delivered to your ryokan room. After it has all been cleared, your futon beds will roll out, and your time in Kanazawa starts to make a little more sense when you are sleeping in the traditional way.

dayInfo.title: Tokyo – The Best of Tokyo for Art Lovers
dayInfo.description: Tokyo is an enormous city, often beyond comprehension for most visitors. It is not just the size that baffles, but it is also the density of everything. People are crowded on streets and crossings, super-skyscrapers are in abundance with barely a gap between street and sky. Over these two days, you will have your focus on art and on food. Whizz to the modern Japanese capital on a bullet train and begin your afternoon in Mori, before a private tour of Kurokawa’s National Art Center. Visit a private gallery and meet a contemporary Japanese artist, and then explore the avant-garde of Roppongi and Harajuku, where pop culture has become art, and fashionistas show you contemporary Tokyo.

dayInfo.title: Tokyo – The Best of Tokyo for Food Lovers
dayInfo.description: Last night, you dined on classic Shun cuisine for just one of the distinctive foods found in a city with over 80,000 restaurants. Today you will delve into other delicacies as you start your day with a sushi-making class, understanding why the food is so delicate and desirable. Although the famous Tsukiji fish market has now closed, you can still search for deep-fried blowfish and slices of rare fish elsewhere in Tokyo. In Kappabashi-Dori, you will explore the Japanese love of presentation, this district full of stalls selling all varieties of kitchen equipment. Submerge yourself in neighborhoods as you go, smelling and listening and tasting your way through the city including Shibuya, Shinjuku, Ginza, and others. You will be full by evening, so perhaps the setting for your final evening is a simple teahouse.

dayInfo.title: Tokyo – Departure
dayInfo.description: This final day is flexible and can be customized dependent on your personal interests. You will be transferred to the airport privately, leaving plenty of time for your outbound flight.

tourName: Romantic Escape to China for Couples
placesVisited: Shanghai, Chengdu, Xian, Beijing, Hainan
generalInfo: Transporting you and your loved one through time in the Former French Concession of Shanghai, soaking in the stunning sunset along the Great Wall, and proclaiming your undying love for one another at the picturesque Sanya are just some of the activities you will experience on this romantic couples trip to China. Create a deeper connection and be enchanted by your partner on this easily personalized 2-week trip through this exotic country.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai – Indulge Your Taste Buds at a Michelin Starred Restaurant
dayInfo.description: The lively city of Shanghai is a must-see attraction for any couple who enjoys walking between the historic and modern world. When your plane arrives at Shanghai Pudong Airport, your private transfer will greet you at the arrivals gate and escort you to your luxury accommodation for the next few days. Once you have settled in, your experienced guide will lead you to the Former French Concession neighborhood. This community was once the richest neighborhood in the city and where you will see pops of European villas and residential homes amongst the historic Chinese homes. As you and your loved one stroll through the European neighborhood, you will sense the harmonious blending of cultures and styles. Shanghainese cuisine is one of the more popular styles of Chinese food, where it focuses on a balanced mix of salty, sweet, and sour. Your guide will direct you to a Michelin starred restaurant where you will indulge all of your senses in an exquisite meal that will go down in history as one of the best you have ever had. Once you have satiated your appetite, you and your partner will take a light sojourn along the water and embrace the warmth of Shanghai.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai – Cuddle in Each Other’s Arms Down the Huangpu River
dayInfo.description: The Bund is one of the most recognizable waterfront walkways in the world. When your experienced guide takes you and your loved one down the Bund, you will receive an intimate and unfolding of Shanghai’s history right before your very eyes. As you and your partner stroll down the Bund, look all around you at the architecture that surrounds the area as it is a living museum from the 1800s. As you traverse the area, you will feel as if you have been transported back in time to see how life was first hand then. Along the Huangpu River, you will board a boat with your guide and sail down the water. The river is also regarded as the Mother river in Shanghai as it serves several functions such as drinking, shipping, drainage, fishery, and tourism. As you and your loved one glide down the water, you will be treated to a split between Shanghai as the river distinguishes between the historic and modern parts. As you look to your left, you will see all the amazing and modern architecture that is a part of the city’s future whereas on the right side, you will see the historic past that Shanghai embodies.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai – Sail Down the Venice of the Orient
dayInfo.description: Just outside of Shanghai, your experienced guide will journey with you to one of the most famous ancient water towns in the country, Zhujiajiao. The town has a similar feel to Venice and is often referenced as the ‘Venice of the Orient’. The main features of the town are the historic waterways, 36 ancient bridges, and traditional Chinese-style residences. As you and your partner board a gondola to glide down the waterway, you will be treated to the peaceful beauty the town exudes with ease. You will recline in the gondola for a relaxing trip around the entire town. Yu Garden was once constructed for a high-ranking official’s parents in their old age and dates back to the Ming dynasty. The officer wanted to build a place that emanates tranquility and peace for anyone who enters. The entire area represents all the classical elements that goes into a traditional Chinese garden, where feng shui was the main focus. As you and your loved one stroll through the magnificent garden, you will be enchanted by all the pavilions, halls, and elegant rockery that will infuse your being with balanced serenity.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai – Submerge Yourself in Hot Springs to Relax
dayInfo.description: The Tanfeng hot springs will be an indulgent treat for you and your partner to submerge yourself in and relax. Your experienced guide will drive you to Wuyi to experience the naturally heated water. There are about 30 pools with different temperatures and water quality, and some which are open air or sheltered by pavilions. The tranquility of the environment and pools will ease your mind and allow you to take a deep breath and just be in the moment. As you and your partner sink deep into the warm waters, you will feel utterly at ease and ready for the upcoming adventures through China. After your long soak in the heated pools, your guide will escort you to a famous hot pot restaurant where you will pamper yourself with wholesome ingredients to create the most healthy broth ever. Once you dip all of your chosen ingredients into the broth, you will be left with a tasty soup that holds all the nutrients from the whole ingredients. As you and your loved one toast each other’s health, you will feel an even deeper connection growing between the two of you.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu – Nourish Baby Pandas in Their Natural Environment
dayInfo.description: Chengdu is home to China’s most famous and lovable creatures, the giant pandas. When your plane descends into Shuangliu Airport in Chengdu, your private transfer will be waiting for you at the arrivals gate to welcome you to the land of the giant panda. After you have settled into your luxury accommodation, your experienced guide will journey with you to the panda research center where you will be able to nourish the bears in their natural environment. As you hug these floppy bears, you will fall deeper in love with these gentle creatures as they will melt anyone’s heart. Leshan Giant Buddha is the largest seated stone-carved Buddhist statue in China, sitting at about 233 feet tall. This UNESCO heritage site took nearly 90 years to complete and was sculpted in this specific location for one reason, to help calm the choppy waters at the confluence of three rivers, namely the Min, Qingyi, and Dadu River. The idea was put forth by the monk Haitong, as the turbulent waters of the rivers prevented shipping vessels from traveling down the river. As you stand in the shadow of the giant Buddha, you will be astounded by the beauty of its surroundings.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu – Master the Art of Chinese Calligraphy
dayInfo.description: The Wide and Narrow Alleys of Chengdu are a historical reserve as the area dates back to the Qing dynasty. The Wide Alley exhibits a more leisure style of living for most locals. Your experienced guide will lead you through both alleys, regaling you with stories from the past as a musician in the alley will play music to set the mood for you. The Narrow Alley features the slow life of Chengdu locals, showcasing the courtyard culture. As you stop to rest in one of the traditional teahouses, you will be able to enjoy the street performances while you sip on a cup of tea. Chinese calligraphy is a style of writing that can be seen as a sport as it embodies the artistic expression of human language in an actual form. When you learn the skills to master the art of Chinese calligraphy, it is held with high esteem in many parts of Asia. You and your loved one will have the chance to sit down with a master calligrapher to learn the basics of how to start writing calligraphy. In learning how to do this, you will also receive the virtue of patience as it takes a slow and steady hand to produce great calligraphy.

dayInfo.title: Xian – Cycle Around the Oldest Fortification in China
dayInfo.description: Xi’an sits at the end of the Silk Road and was once the capital city of 13 imperial dynasties. When you arrive at Xianyang Airport, your private transfer will welcome you to the city where its history tells the story of China. Once you are settled into your luxury accommodation, your experienced guide will take you to view the Terracotta Warriors. When you and your partner walk into thes mausoleum, you will be astonished to discover the sea of soldiers that stand guard for the first emperor. If you look closely, you will discover each statue has its own expression, hand gesture, and uniform. The Ancient City Wall of Xi’an is the best-preserved fortification in China. There are four main gates that are called eternity, joy, peace, and harmony to grace anyone who passes through with these qualities. You will be able to cycle around the city wall with your partner and guide and watch life happen in the city center. As you bike around the city center, you will see groups of people practicing their Tai Chi to help equalize the ‘chi’ in their bodies. A light breeze will brush past you and you will look over at your partner and laugh with delight.

dayInfo.title: Xian – Ascend to the Tops of Huashan
dayInfo.description: The natural vistas surrounding Huashan are as famous as the five peaks that have their own distinctive charms. Your experienced guide will take you to the top of Huashan where you will enjoy the sunrise over the East Peak. As you clasp hands with your loved one and lean against them, you will feel the love you have for one another deepen. The mountain is also home to several influential Taoist temples, where several emperors in multiple dynasties took part in Taoist activities and sacrificed to the god of the mountain in order to worship heaven. The Great Mosque is the largest mosque in China where it was built in 742 during the Tang dynasty, as it was the result of Islam introduced to China by Arab merchants and travelers. The Muslims played an important role during the Yuan and Ming dynasties when China was in the midst of unifying. When you enter into the Great Mosque, you will be surprised to see the perfect blending of Muslim and Chinese architectural styles in the centuries’ old design. And the further you and your partner venture into the place, the more serene you will feel.

dayInfo.title: Xian – Immerse Yourself in Food and Folk Culture
dayInfo.description: Yuanjia Village is the perfect place for anyone to view the Chinese food and folk culture up close and personal. Your experienced guide will drive you to the village where the simplicity of the housing designs, mostly from the Qing dynasty, speaks to the core of the locals living there. When you order a bowl of noodles, you will be treated to a chef with lightning fast hands that can pull and stretch dough multiple times to create artwork that will become your noodles. It is definitely a sight to remember. The Drum and Bell Tower were built during the Ming dynasty and used to signify the starting or ending of important events. The Bell Tower is located in the center of the old city and surrounded by a circle of traffic. As you and your guide make your way through the underground walkway to the tower, you will be able to climb to the top of the wooden tower to have a panoramic view of the city. The Drum Tower was built earlier than its sister tower and has many large drums and various instruments that are often featured in performances. Their sound could be heard echoing throughout the city.

dayInfo.title: Beijing – Traverse the UNESCO Heritage Sites of Beijing
dayInfo.description: The capital of China is best known for its storied history that stretches out three millennia but it is also known for its modern architecture. Once your plane lands at Beijing International Airport, your private transfer will whisk you and your loved one to your luxury accommodation. When you have settled in, your experienced guide will bring you to the main UNESCO heritage sites in Beijing, namely the Forbidden City and the Summer Palace. The Forbidden City is the largest imperial palace in the entire world, topping up at 980 buildings with over 8700 rooms. As you and your partner traverse through the intimidating red walls, you will be entering a world that only the imperial family or invited high-ranking officials were allowed to cross. The Summer Palace is the ultimate in exquisite gardening. It encompasses lakes, gardens, and palaces and is still influential in today’s gardening as it was seen as a masterpiece in Chinese landscape design. Everything that was planted or built in the garden perfectly harmonizes with one another, from the plants and the paths to the architecture and horticulture. The palace epitomizes the philosophy and practice of Chinese garden design.

dayInfo.title: Beijing – Tantalize Your Senses with Peking Duck
dayInfo.description: The Great Wall of China is famous all around the world and has survived many intrusions from its northerly neighbors, the Mongols. It winds along hills and valleys like steel grey backbone of a dragon. When your experienced guide escorts you to the Great Wall, you will have the chance to scale the fortification hand-in-hand with your loved one. At the resting point, you will gaze out into the surrounding lush areas and take a deep breath of fresh air, letting it fill you with renewed energy. When you and your partner look out from your vantage point, you will feel as if you can do anything together. There are many aspects to Beijing cuisine that make it so tasty but the most famous dish of all is the Peking duck. This dish was only served to the imperial family and high-ranking officials so when you have the chance to bite into this savory morsel, you will feel as if you have reached another state of being. The Peking duck has a golden brown crispy skin that shelters tender meat and is wrapped in a paper-thin flour pancake, then topped with a dollop of hoisin sauce and a green onion.

dayInfo.title: Beijing – Behold the Stunning Sunset over the Great Wall
dayInfo.description: Aside from the Summer Palace, Beihai Park is also one of the well-preserved and oldest imperial gardens in the center of the capital. The architectural style of the entire garden is astounding and as you wander through the place, you will feel the serenity that is prevalent in every corner infusing your every soul. In the park, you will come across the infamous Nine Dragon Screen, the only screen with nine dragons inlaid on both sides. The screen was originally built in 1756 and is composed of 424 seven color glazed tiles embossing the screen. The artwork showcases the ancient artistic techniques used to maintain the still vibrant colors that is evident today. The Great Wall of China is not only an architectural engineering marvel but the perfect place to view a stunning sunset. As your guide drives you to the ancient fortification, you will be able to climb up the Jinshanling portion of the wall in order to catch the sun turn the sky a fiery red before it dips below the horizon. Your evening will culminate with your guide directing you to a Michelin starred restaurant where you will delight your palate with incredible food and drink.

dayInfo.title: Hainan – Proclaim Your Undying Love at Tianya Haijiao
dayInfo.description: The Hainan island is best known as the ‘Hawaii of the Orient’ and will provide you and your loved one with the most romantic end to your tour through China. When your plane arrives at Phoenix International Airport in Sanya, your private transfer will welcome you and take you to your luxury accommodation. After you have settled in, your experienced guide will take you to Luhuitou Park where you will enjoy a sweeping view of all of Sanya. It is the only mountain-top park in the city so you will have a great view of the vast sea and natural scenery to add to your perfect holiday. The scenic and romantic spot of Tianya Haijiao is the best place for the culmination of your trip. The name ‘Tianya Haijiao’ translates to the point where the earth meets the sky and it is the place where many couples proclaim their undying love for one another. As you and your loved one stroll hand-in-hand through the beach, you will be beset with deep emotions for one another as the area is heaven for people who are head over heels in love. This place will remain in your hearts and memories forever.

dayInfo.title: Hainan – Plunge into Love at the Gorgeous Coral Island
dayInfo.description: Immaculate coral reefs beneath emerald-green waters and soft white sand beaches are just some of the gorgeous things you will find at Wuzhizhou Coral Island just off the main Hainan island. Your experienced guide will lead you to Sunrise Rock which will be the perfect spot for you and your partner to gaze upon the rising sun. The Lover’s Bridge is a long wooden bridge that connects Wuzhizhou Island with a pavilion built out on a reef at sea. It is said that if you walk hand in hand through the couple who arc over the bridge in a heart, your love will stand the test of time. Sanya is well-known for its brilliant coral reefs and vibrant tropical fish. As you and your loved one don your scuba diving gear, you will plunge deeper into love as you swim through the waters to discover the magnificent world underwater. When you surface, you and your partner will feel elated at the adventure you have had through the amorous parts of China. As your private transfer brings you to the airport, you will snuggle in closer to your loved one, knowing that you have created truly unforgettable memories in China.

tourName: Romantic Itinerary to China and Japan
placesVisited: Tokyo, Shinjuku, Harajuku, Hakone, Kyoto, Myoshinji, Â Imaniya Shinto shrine, Takayama, Sanmachi Suji, Hida, Shirakawa-go, Shanghai, The Bund, Tongli, Beijing, Forbidden City, Lijiang, Yangshuo, Guilin
generalInfo: Japan and China are two countries that always capture the heart of any traveler. Imagine hot springs and ryokans, the bustling cities alongside the ancient wonders and inspiring histories discovered in bucolic old-world towns with landscapes as if from a dream. This will be an evocative adventure made for two, abounding with romantic surprises and the small moments that make you fall in love. Begin in Tokyo, relax in Hakone, savor cultural Kyoto, and then traditional Takayama. Travel on to Shanghai, Beijing, Lijiang, and Yangshuo for a complete journey through these two fascinating destinations.

dayInfo.title: Tokyo – Five-Star Introductions
dayInfo.description: Tokyo is a dazzling city to begin your vacation as the lights flash and the energy whisks you away. Touch down and check into your hotel high in the sky with large windows looking out on a city that comes alive at night. It is peaceful up here, the skyline stretching out in its various shades of neon, but it is energetic down on the street, and your guide will provide a brief orientation. You will be introduced to the trademark bustle and end in a classic Japanese restaurant for your first dining experience. It will be a laid-back dining setting for the first night of this romantic tour, contemporary local cuisine with the odd sip of sake as a compliment.

dayInfo.title: Tokyo – Exploring a City of Contrasts
dayInfo.description: Tokyo is an enormous city with incredible contrasts, a destination far too complex to wrap your head around in a single day. It will be difficult to prescribe an itinerary for the day, even if having an exact timetable would be classically Japanese. Your guide will meet you over breakfast and discuss today’s potential routes, ensuring you get to see parts of Tokyo that most captures your imagination. That could be the culture in Harajuku, flashing lights in Akihabara, that famous Shibuya pedestrian crossing, or perhaps both the city’s old and new art scenes. Food could also be a focus, from tuna sashimi to holes in the wall where locals dine. Although Tokyo’s size is unmistakable, a journey through central suburbs quickly introduces you to differing neighborhoods, each one such a contrast from the next.

dayInfo.title: Hakone – Traditional Ryokan and Hot Springs
dayInfo.description: Tokyo’s bustle is quickly replaced by mountain serenity, a train whizzing you to Hakone and a mountain retreat. It will begin to feel more quintessentially romantic, with a bubbling private hot spring and a view onto bucolic slopes. You will be staying in a ryokan, the most traditional and authentic of Japanese accommodations. It will be an intimate home away from home with tatami mats, sliding doors, and your own private onsen. Dinner is kaiseki style with beautifully presented small dishes based on the seasons, served to your room as the promise of a memorable time away together.

dayInfo.title: Hakone – The Romance of Japanese Mountains
dayInfo.description: Wake late and savor the impeccable ryokan service. Although they sometimes seem simple, ryokans are all about the attention to detail and sense of serenity they provide. Begin with breakfast in your room, dip once more in the onsen, and plan a private self-guided day in the mountains. A cable car and ropeway can take you up the mountain, or you could cross the lake in a mock pirate ship. Some of Japan’s best whiskey distillers are but a short drive away, and there are also some good museums in the surrounding valley. Tonight’s dinner is kaiseki style, as always, another dozen courses of local organic produce, from sashimi slices to homemade pickles, vegetable tempura plus meat sizzled on a hot stone barbecue.

dayInfo.title: Kyoto – Authentic Tea Ceremony and Temple Delight
dayInfo.description: Whizz your way onwards, a Shinkansen train taking you to Kyoto and into Japan’s cultural heart. Here, temples hide in bamboo forests, doorways lead you to extravagant zen gardens, and the historical atmosphere confronts you at every turn. Check into a ryokan and set off into this city of delights, visiting a shrine and temple that seem to summarize old-world Japan. Rest and relax with a traditional tea ceremony, once again simplicity and serenity meeting a remarkable attention to detail. Wander hand in hand through the bamboo, waiting for the trunks to give way to a garden, pond, and 13th-century temple untouched by time. For many, Kyoto is Japan’s most romantic city. It’s undoubtedly the most cultural and you cannot escape the time-warped ambiance.

dayInfo.title: Kyoto – Hand in Hand Through Japan’s Finest Gardens
dayInfo.description: With your expert local guide, you can enter Kyoto’s unknown parts, spending a day in temples and gardens that are usually closed to the public. Explore zen at its best, the tranquility of gardens ideal for a languid morning stroll. Delve into crumbling moss-covered shrines, where artistic detail now mingles with nature. Enter the imperial palace and step into a different era, feeling the tales that now whisper from walls. You can cover eight centuries and many eras in a single day, learning about the history while witnessing how the artistic style has changed. Along the way, there is more tea, some of Japan’s most iconic kaiseki cuisine, and an exclusivity that keeps you away from the sometimes-crowded Kyoto monuments.

dayInfo.title: Takayama – Old-World Japan at its Best
dayInfo.description: If Kyoto is a cultural journey through the ages, then Takayama is an immersion in a specific time – the Edo period. The old town is better preserved than almost anywhere else in the country, yet it is not a museum piece. Merchants still trade beneath the artisanal roofs, family chatter seeps out from wood-framed windows, and organized clutter distinguishes antique stores. Walking over elaborate bridges, you can explore Takayama with a local guide, uncovering the what, when and why of Edo, then finishing at Sanmachi Suji. Your evening meal also comes from history. Takayama, in Hida, produces the most revered of all Japanese wagyu beef, its softness and marbling bringing new definition to melt in the mouth.

dayInfo.title: Takayama – Ryokan, Hida Beef and Shirakawa-go
dayInfo.description: Another morning in a ryokan, and another quiet stroll through old-world Japan with a journey into the one place that’s even better preserved than Takayama. Thatched-roof farmhouses dominate Shirakawa-go, their trademark shape as iconic as windmills are to the Netherlands or canals are to Venice. Unlike Takayama, it feels like a museum village with not a strand out of place in this remote mountain valley. The setting is sublime, and your guide can show you a couple of mountain trails should you wish to walk. Returning back to Takayama, you will watch as the town ambiance changes at dusk with the feeling of a lived-in old city best displayed through soft lights and evening chatter.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai – Sky Bars, Historic Quarters and a Change in Culture
dayInfo.description: Your journey from Takayama to Shanghai will bring incredible contrast into view. Zoom towards the sky with cocktails on the 55th floor, and then step through the shimmering glass and metal of contemporary Shanghai. Get lost alongside your guide in what remains of Shanghai’s historic quarter, and keep walking to travel into ramshackle lanes of teahouses and musty smells. As one quarter leads to another, you will find the faded grandeur of French Shanghai, which is such a contrast to the skyscrapers elsewhere. Shanghai brings a change in tempo and culture, but it us a great destination for easing into the experience of China. Tonight, you can have a romantic dinner at a Michelin-starred restaurant high above the city with almost two-dozen courses served in an outrageously over-the-top setting, which is another significant contrast from the ryokan and kaiseki experiences.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai – The Amorous Canals of Tongli
dayInfo.description: Canals twist through old China just an hour outside of Shanghai. They suggest an ancient time, especially when a boat takes you beneath low-slung bridges. Step into a traditional tea ceremony and compare the flavors with Japan. Visit antique stores and gaze up at dusty revolution posters. Find peace in Tongli and have some time to explore just as two, perhaps getting a photo where the bridge arches 360 through its water reflection. Return to Shanghai and the rest of the day is at your leisure. Your guide can suggest places to go – old or new – along with restaurants and bars that epitomize the city’s contemporary, world-leading style.

dayInfo.title: Beijing – Don’t Miss the Great Wall and Forbidden City
dayInfo.description: An early morning flight to Beijing gives the two of you an action-packed 24 hours at China’s most famous highlights. Touch down and take a helicopter out to the Great Wall of China, propellers whirling as you gasp at the structure’s scale. From the air, it makes sense, this twisting mass of stone that cuts through mountain and valley. Its scale is revealed, even if you see but a tiny fraction of the almost 10,000 miles of wall built to repel Mongol invaders. Stepping out onto a relatively less visited part of the wall, you can wander along the enormous slabs to appreciate just how high they built this defense. Head into Beijing, and check into your hotel with its contemporary glass-fronted accommodation similar to what you had in Tokyo. While Beijing now rises high, it is still very historical at heart, and just as imposing. Step inside the Forbidden City and stand in awe at its details. Sculpted lions, flowing temples, cobbled stone and a sense of history all abound, and there is nothing on this scale anywhere else in the world. Nearby is the Temple of Heaven, a place popular with Chinese couples seeking good luck for the future. Embrace its sanctified atmosphere, join hands beneath painted facades, and then take a rest as dusk draws near. It will be one of the busiest days of the tour, but the trilogy of famous sights are worth the rushing around.

dayInfo.title: Lijiang – The Slow Pace of Old-Town China
dayInfo.description: You have got time for some self-exploration in Beijing this morning, perhaps even joining locals doing tai chi in a city park. Move next to fly direct to Lijiang for some very relaxing days in southern China. Lijiang harks back to medieval times, with grand gates leading into an expertly restored city where not a stone is out of place. Stroll across the tiny bridges and down narrow lanes, twisting through a piece of China where vehicles cannot go. Hear the historical tales from your guide, learning when Lijiang came to prominence and also its mostly unknown influence on the Western world. Soak up the slow pace of life and spend two nights in a boutique hotel, where you sleep amid the history. Day 12 is guided and takes you around all the important sights, as well as ensuring you have your bearings. Day 13 is at your leisure, and you may wish to take it easy in Lijiang, simply taking more hand in hand walks down 13th-century lanes. The town is flanked by dramatic mountains, which cast their shadow from mid-afternoon onwards. Here you can go hiking or horseback riding, an adventure that brings up images of the Great Silk Road and arriving in Lijiang from a forested slope. You will find that evening is a great time to be outside on the city streets, lanterns illuminating local scenes as the pace of life grows slower still.

dayInfo.title: Yangshuo – The Even Slower Pace of Guilin, Yangshuo and Yulong Cruising
dayInfo.description: Yangshuo is just as exotic and old-world, although the setting is even more dramatic. Fly to Guilin and transfer through a landscape of rice paddies and limestone karst, arriving in Yangshuo for an afternoon of cruising. You will travel privately on a bamboo raft, drifting down the Yulong River as majestic peaks rise in all directions. It is so peaceful out here, the two of you floating along, the scenery as memorable as any in Asia. In one part of the river, the karst creates a natural amphitheater, a setting for the Liu Shanjie impressions show. During the show, lights dance across water and mountain, and you have the best seats on the evening of day 14. Your final day in China will begin with a cooking class, a fun and informal experience that begins with sourcing ingredients from a local market. Throw food around, create classic Chinese dishes, and settle into the kitchen exoticism. This afternoon you can choose between a private cycle trip above the karst or another boat cruise on the Yulong River. Both provide tranquility in nature and a final slice of rural China to take home in your memories. And as the sun sets and you watch the landscape change color from a private balcony, you can reflect on the last two weeks as the two of you took in the best of Japan and China.

dayInfo.title: Yangshuo – Departure
dayInfo.description: Depart from Yangshuo this morning, making a domestic flight connection before returning home after this romantic vacation.

tourName: Romantic Side of China: 7-Day Tour for Couples
placesVisited: Shanghai, Suzhou, Chengdu, Hainan Island, Hong Kong
generalInfo: Experience the allure and mystery of China during this exotic and romantic 7-day adventure that will provide you with the ultimate culture shock. Visit the Paris of the Orient and astonish your taste buds with the feng shui flavors of cuisine in Shanghai. Dine at a Michelin-starred restaurant, trek to the summit of Mt. Emei, and immerse yourself in the unique culture of China.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai - Feng Shui Flavors
dayInfo.description: When you arrive at Shanghai Pudong Airport, your private transfer will lead you on a gentle ride down the Huangpu River after you have had a chance to check in to your luxurious accommodation. You will cruise the length of the river and witness the harmonious blend of Eastern and Western influence that is imbued in the architectural landmarks. Afterward, you will be escorted to explore the Bund. One of the best parts of Shanghai is its use of feng shui with its cuisine, which blends multiple flavors together to create a balanced blend of salty, sweet, and spicy.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai - The Twin Bridges
dayInfo.description: The day will begin with a historical exploration, and your guide will drive you to the Zhouzhuang Water Village, which is located just outside of Shanghai. You and your partner can stroll across the twin bridges of Shide and Yong’an, where the layout of the two creates a giant Chinese key. From there, you will receive an exclusive peek behind the hidden door of Old Town or Nanshi, which is not open to the public. Your guide will then escort you to Yu Garden. Near the end of the night, you will dine at a Michelin-starred restaurant that encompasses experimental dining with a twist.

dayInfo.title: Suzhou - The Venice of China
dayInfo.description: Once your bullet train from Shanghai arrives in Suzhou, you will be transported to an Asian paradise. At the train station, your private transfer will guide you and your partner to Tongli Water Village. You will float down the canals in a gondola ride and gaze up at the sky for a peaceful introduction to Suzhou. The cuisine of Suzhou is known as one of the eight culinary arts in China, and you will indulge in their elaborate way of cooking. Afterward, your guide will drive you to Tiger Hill, which has a pagoda that sits on the hill’s summit.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu - Hiking at Mt. Emei
dayInfo.description: Today, your private charter will descend into the city of Chengdu, which is known as the land of abundance. Upon your arrival, your private transfer will drive you out to the Wolong National Nature Reserve, where you will have the opportunity to feed and play with baby pandas. As you leave part of your heart behind at the panda reserve, your guide will escort you to Mt. Emei, which is the highest mountain in the area. Kuanzhai Alley is famous for its ability to combine Chengdu’s historical and cultural reserves all in one area. Here, you will explore ancient tea houses as well as the daily lives of Chengdu locals.

dayInfo.title: Hainan Island - The Hawaii of China
dayInfo.description: Known across Asia as the Hawaii of China, Hainan Island is also famous because it is an excellent place to explore or escape the bustle of the mainland. Upon your arrival, your private transfer will escort you to the Yanoda Rainforest, which is known for its serene valleys, waterfalls, and springs. Afterward, your guide will lead you to Tianya Haijiao, which is referred to as the Ends of the Earth. This is a remote area where the Chinese believed Heaven and Earth meet. After your idyllic day of relaxing around Hainan Island, you will be given the remainder of the day to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Hong Kong - Michelin-Starred Dim Sum
dayInfo.description: The bustling energy of Hong Kong will be evident the minute your plane lands at the Hong Kong International Airport. Upon your arrival, your private transfer will greet you and usher you off to the highly anticipated portion of your trip: the Michelin-starred dim sum restaurant. Afterward, your guide will drive you to Victoria Peak for a gentle walk to the summit. At the top of the peak, you will be offered a spectacular 360-degree view of Hong Kong with all of its neighborhoods. You will then venture to Tsim Sha Tsui promenade. At the main port, you will board a Chinese Junk Boat and sail to Victoria Harbour.

dayInfo.title: Hong Kong - Departure
dayInfo.description: On your final morning in Hong Kong, your guide will lead you to the Tian Tan Buddha or the Big Buddha at Ngong Ping Plateau. The view from the top of the hill is astounding and will take your breath away as you gaze out across the landscape. After you descend the hill by foot or cable car, your guide will direct you to Hong Kong International Airport for your departure home.

tourName: Spectacular Tour of China for Seniors: Rural Villages to Bustling Cities
placesVisited: Hong Kong, Shanghai, Yangshuo, Chengdu, Xian, Beijing
generalInfo: Designed for seniors who love adventure and luxurious amenities, this 2-week China tour will leave you yearning to see more of this exotic country. Witness panoramic views of Hong Kong from Victoria Peak, immerse yourself in authentic Chinese culture in the rural villages of Yangshuo, and sail down the Li River.

dayInfo.title: Hong Kong - Victoria Peak
dayInfo.description: When you land in Hong Kong, your private transfer will greet and transfer you to your luxurious accommodation. After having some time to relax after your long flight, your guide will lead you to Victoria Peak. The top of the peak offers incredible views of the city, and you will have the option to walk or take a tram to the summit. A visit to Hong Kong cannot be complete without dining on dim sum. After your guided walk to Victoria Peak, you will have the remainder of the evening at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Hong Kong - Junk Boat Sail
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, you will venture to Lantau Island, which is the largest island in Hong Kong. Upon your arrival, you will take a cable car that will provide you with a 360-degree view of the island. Afterward, you will witness the Tian Tan Buddha. The statue was created to symbolize the harmonious relationship that man has with nature. You will then return to the city for a walk along Tsim Sha Tsui promenade. When you reach the main wharf, you will board a traditional junk boat and sail out to sea.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai - Stroll Through the Bund
dayInfo.description: Today, you will have an early morning so that you can fly to Shanghai. After meeting your guide and settling in to your accommodation, your guide will escort you to the city’s French Concession. Once you arrive, you will notice that the architecture appears more European in style than it does Chinese. You can also do some high-end shopping here. Afterward, you will transfer to the Bund. In the evening, the entire area puts on an impressive light show.

dayInfo.title: Shanghai - Views of Shanghai
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, your guide will lead you to the financial district of Shanghai. This is where the city’s largest skyscrapers reside, and you were able to catch a glimpse at the bund yesterday. You will take an elevator to the top of the World Financial Center, walk out onto the terrace, and witness gorgeous views of the city. Afterward, you will visit the Yu Garden, which was created by a high-ranking officer who wanted to create a special place for his parents in their old age.

dayInfo.title: Yangshuo - The Villages of Yangshuo
dayInfo.description: Early this morning, you will transfer to the traditional villages in Yangshuo, which date back to the Tang dynasty. You will be staying in one of the villages, and you will settle in before venturing out for the day. Your guide will first lead you through Jiuxian Village, where you can wander across small alleyways that lead you to ancient dwellings. The locals are very welcoming and will attempt to engage you in conversation. As the evening begins to descend, you will partake in a Tai Chi lesson.

dayInfo.title: Yangshuo - Stunning Landscapes
dayInfo.description: The stunning landscapes of Yangshuo are legendary, and many have captured it in paintings and poetry. After breakfast this morning, you will board a boat and sail down the Li River for a closer look at the magnificent scenery. The cuisine in Yangshuo harnesses spicy and sweet flavors. Since the city is located on the river, its famous dishes revolve around seafood. To discover these hidden gems, your guide will lead you on a food tour that will take you to some of the villages’ top eateries.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu - Encounter Baby Pandas
dayInfo.description: Today, you will have an early morning so that you can fly to Chengdu. Upon your arrival, your guide will transfer you to your accommodation, where you can settle in before visiting the panda research center. Here, you will be able to nurture and play with the rare animals. Chengdu is located in the Sichuan province, which is known for its vibrant style of cooking. After your encounters with pandas, you will experience the delight of Sichuan cooking.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu - The Leshan Buddha
dayInfo.description: The Leshan Giant Buddha is one of the largest carved stone seated Buddhist statues in the world. It was started during the Tang dynasty in 713 and took nearly 90 years to complete. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is carved out of the cliffside of red sandstones, giving it a reddish hue. After breakfast this morning, you will have the luxury of visiting the Giant Buddha. Afterward, you will venture to Jinli Street, where you can stroll through the town at your leisure before attending a master puppeteer show.

dayInfo.title: Xi’an - The Terracotta Warriors
dayInfo.description: Early in the morning, you will fly to Xi’an, which is famous for its Terracotta Warriors. After having some time to settle in to the comforts of your new surroundings, your guide will transfer you to the mausoleum that holds the entire Terracotta Army. You will be astonished to discover that each of the statues was carved with a different expression, hand gesture, and uniform. Afterward, you will visit The Giant Wild Goose Pagoda for a tremendous view from the top.

dayInfo.title: Xi’an - Delicious Cuisine
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, you will visit the Fortifications of Xi’an. This is the most complete wall that has survived in China, and it is one of the largest ancient military defense systems in the world. As you cycle around the Ancient City Wall with your guide, you will be provided with an incredible view of the city center. Your guide will then escort you through the city streets, where you will be treated to 12 different scenic regions.

dayInfo.title: Beijing - Visit Heritage Sites
dayInfo.description: Today will be the day that you finally transfer to the capital of China. After landing at Beijing International Airport, you will have some time to relax in the comforts of your new accommodation before visiting two UNESCO World Heritage Sites: the Forbidden City and the Temple of Heaven. The Forbidden City is the largest and most well-preserved imperial palace in the world. The Temple of Heaven was once a sacrificial altar for the emperors to pray for a bountiful harvest.

dayInfo.title: Beijing - A Traditional Rickshaw
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, you will have some time at your leisure before meeting your guide, who will lead you around the city while you relax in a traditional rickshaw. During your tour, you will glide through the alleyways and neighborhoods of the city with ease. Beijing cuisine has many culinary specialties, but the most famous is Peking duck. A trip to Beijing would not be complete without a meal of Peking or Beijing duck. Your guide can provide you with excellent recommendations on where to indulge in the regional delicacy.

dayInfo.title: Beijing - Ascend the Great Wall
dayInfo.description: Today, you will visit the most famous of all things Chinese: the Great Wall of China. The wall was built during the Ming dynasty to keep out the invading Mongols. After breakfast this morning, you will have the chance to examine the wall’s curved form. Instead of viewing the wall from up-close, you will witness it from the vantage point of a flying helicopter. When the helicopter touches down, you will ascend to the Mutianyu portion of the Great Wall. Afterward, you will visit the Summer Palace to conclude your day.

dayInfo.title: Beijing - Departure
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will have a morning visit to Tiananmen Square before venturing to the airport for your flight home. At Tiananmen Square, your guide will lead you on a brief tour before allowing you some time to explore on your own.

tourName: Unexplored Gems of China: Unique Two-Week Tour
placesVisited: Guilin, Lijiang, Xian, Chongqing, Chengdu
generalInfo: Designed for adventure enthusiasts who desire to explore lesser-known regions, this 2-week China tour allows you to uncover many of China’s hidden treasures.

dayInfo.title: Guilin - Arrival
dayInfo.description: When you land in Guilin, a private driver will be waiting to greet and transfer you to your accommodation in the heart of the city. Upon reaching your accommodation, you will have some time to settle in and relax after your long flight. When you are ready, your guide will lead you to the Longji Rice Terraces, where you can ascend to the top of the terraces. Guilin cuisine is the perfect blend of Cantonese and Hunanese cultures.

dayInfo.title: Guilin - The Town of Daxu
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, your guide will lead you to The Jingjiang mansion, which was built for Prince Jingjiang during the Ming dynasty and surrounds the Solitary Beauty Peak. During your visit, you can traverse the grounds of the mansion and climb to the top of the peak for incredible views. Afterward, you will transfer to the town of Daxu for a private tour. This is a rural town, making it very unique when compared to the bustling cities of Shanghai and Beijing.

dayInfo.title: Guilin - Incredible Artistry
dayInfo.description: Guilin is known around China as being one of the most beautiful landscapes in the country. After breakfast, your guide will lead you on a sail down the Li River. The water buffalo will graze in the water, fishermen may balance on a raft, and school children may be sailing to classes. Eventually, you will reach the Silver Cave, which is the largest karst cave in Guilin. There are several scenic areas to explore in the cave, but the most fascinating area is the Flying Waterfall of Snow Mountain.

dayInfo.title: Lijiang - Tiger Leaping Gorge
dayInfo.description: The city of Lijiang is favored with plenty of sunlight and clear spring water, creating a refreshing appearance from afar. You will have an early morning so that you can fly to Lijiang, and upon your arrival, a private transfer will be on hand to greet you and make sure that you get settled in to your accommodation. When you are ready, your guide will lead you to Tiger Leaping Gorge, where you will be able to hike the trails along the canyon. Eventually, your guide will lead you to a lookout point for some spectacular views.

dayInfo.title: Lijiang - Jade Dragon Snow Mountain
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, your guide will lead you to Jade Dragon Snow Mountain, which has an altitude of 18,360 feet at its highest peak. The mountains are almost always covered in snow and fog, and it may appear like a silver dragon in the clouds. At the base of the mountain, you will have the option of riding to the top in a cable car or to hike the well-marked trails. Regardless of what you choose, you will transfer to the Old Town for Lijian for a relaxing tour of the UNESCO World Heritage Site.

dayInfo.title: Xi’an - The Loess Plateau
dayInfo.description: Xi’an was once the ancient capital of 13 dynasties. Today, it is home to several famous archaeological and cultural sites. After breakfast, you will fly to Xi’an, where you will have the chance to explore. A private driver will greet and lead you through the logistics of checking in to your new accommodation. When you are ready, your guide will take you on a private helicopter flight of the Loess Plateau. After your tour, you will have the rest of the evening to spend at your leisure, and your guide can provide you with excellent dining recommendations.

dayInfo.title: Xi’an - Jade Carving Course
dayInfo.description: After a leisurely morning today, your guide will direct you to the Lantian Jade Factory, where you will have the chance to watch a true artisan as they delicately carve jade. Jade has always been an important part of Chinese culture as a symbol of goodness, preciousness, and beauty. In Xi’an, Lantian jade carving is an important part of the culture. After your jade-carving demonstration, you will visit the Giant Buddha Temple, which is known for its massive Amitabha statue and remarkable grottoes.

dayInfo.title: Xi’an - The Huaqing Palace
dayInfo.description: Huaqing Palace is the epitome of a royal garden in the province of Shaanxi. After breakfast this morning, you will visit the palace with your guide. The palace has a long recorded history of almost three millennia, and it once functioned as the home to many dynastic rulers. The main garden of the palace is Furong Garden that fully embodies the style of the Tang dynasty. You will have the chance to tour the garden before dipping into the healing waters of a hot spring.

dayInfo.title: Chongqing - Witness Dazu Carvings
dayInfo.description: The city of Chongqing was built in the mountains and surrounded by the Yangtze and Jialing Rivers. Today, you will fly to Chongqing, where a private driver will make sure that you are greeted and have a seamless transition to your new accommodation. When you have settled in to your new surroundings, your guide will lead you on a tour to the UNESCO World Heritage Site of the Dazu Rock Carvings, which is a series of religious sculptures that date back to the 7th century. Afterward, you will visit Fengdu Ghost town before having the rest of the evening to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Chongqing - Visiting Ancient Villages
dayInfo.description: The ancient village of Ciqikou sits along the banks of the Jialing River and its history can be traced back over 1,700 years. During the Ming and Qing dynasties, Ciqikou was known for its production of porcelain, and over 20 old kilns were discovered around the village. Many of the buildings that are still standing originated from the Ming and Qing dynasty eras. After breakfast, you will traverse this incredible site with a private guide. This will be the only thing planned for the day, and your guide can provide you with excellent dining recommendations as well.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu - The Culture of Mt. Emei
dayInfo.description: Chengdu may be best known for its panda, but there are many other things to explore and experience. After breakfast, you will fly to Chengdu, where a guide will see that you are properly transitioned to your new accommodation. After settling in, your guide will escort you to Mt. Emei, which is the highest mountain in China. According to archaeological reports, people lived on Mt. Emei as early as 5,000 years ago. You will have the choice to summit the top via a cable car or via the well-groomed hiking trails.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu - Learning about Chinese Tea
dayInfo.description: Qingyang Palace is one of the most famous Taoist temples in China. Here, it was originally built during the Tang dynasty. As you traverse through the pavilion and palace with your guide, you will come upon several locals as they take drink tea. You will be able to sit and share a moment with them if you desire. You will then transfer to Mengding Mountain, which is famous for its five peaks. Here, you will learn more about Mengshan tea.

dayInfo.title: Zhangjiajie - Spectacular Views
dayInfo.description: In the early morning, you will fly to Zhangjiajie, which is the home of the famous karst peaks of China. A private driver will see to it that your transition to your new accommodation goes smoothly. When you are ready, your guide will lead you to the Zhangjiajie Grand Canyon. In the canyon, you will explore the plunging waterfalls and incredible scenery. As you hike your way through the canyon, you will come across the longest and highest glass bridge in the world.

dayInfo.title: Zhangjiajie - Departure
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, your guide will escort you to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: Wonders of China Tour: Great Wall, Terracotta Warriors and Pandas
placesVisited: Beijing, Forbidden City, Xi’an, Chengdu, Dujiangyan Panda Base, Chengdu city, Shibaozhai, Shanghai
generalInfo: Witness a fascinating collection of the world’s most spellbinding wonders as you embark on this unforgettable tour of the Middle Kingdom. Experience a range of incredibly close encounters with the mesmerizing giant pandas as you spend a day cuddling, feeding and looking after these wonderful creatures in the Dujiangyan Panda Base. Visit the tranquil areas of one of the Earth's most famous landmarks as you explore The Great Wall, and then admire the serene waterfalls and the natural landscape as you sail down the Yangtze River. Be awe-inspired in the incredible historical city of Xi’an, the home of the famous Terracotta Warriors. Visit Beijing’s finest sights and landmarks, and then take in the culture and modernity of Shanghai before experiencing the unique delights of Chengdu.

dayInfo.title: Beijing - Arrival
dayInfo.description: Touch down in the capital of the Middle Kingdom to be greeted by your friendly guide who will escort you to your hotel. Depending on your arrival time, you may simply settle into your hotel for the night, or you might take to the streets of the bustling city to begin your adventure.

dayInfo.title: Beijing - Tour of Tiananmen Square, the Forbidden City and Traditional Neighborhoods
dayInfo.description: Pull back those curtains bright and early and begin with Tiananmen Square, a city square that sits at the heart of Beijing. This area possesses an incredible amount of political and cultural significance, and you will feel that as you arrive. At the center of the square sits the Monument to People’s Heroes, a simple yet beautiful marble and stone structure that honors the heroes of modern Chinese history. Nearby is the Great Hall of People, which stands at an overwhelming size and demonstrates architectural mastery, this structure is among the largest of its kind. The Great Hall serves as a host for the state leaders, who hold various diplomatic meetings within its walls, including the National People’s Congress. Facing the Great Hall of People is the National Museum of China, incorporating both the Chinese History Museum and the Chinese Revolutionary Museum. Not only is it China’s largest history museum, but it also possesses the country’s most significant ancient items. It is a truly spellbinding journey into the history and culture of the Middle Kingdom with some relics that date back to centuries past. Travel next to take in the wonders of the Forbidden City, an incredible imperial palace with landscaped gardens and fascinating buildings that date back to 1406. Covering an area of 950 by 750 meters, the Forbidden City possesses almost 1,000 buildings, withholding almost 9,000 rooms. Home to emperors during the Ming and Qing Dynasty, its name originates from the principle that only a select number of individuals were allowed to enter its hallowed grounds which lends explanation to the 52-meter-wide moat and eight-meter-high wall that surrounds the area. Finish your day’s explorations as you explore the fascinating old streets, the hutongs , of Beijing. As you weave your way in and out of the winding, narrow lanes you will see local families playing traditional board games, cooking food and engaging with each other. You can even visit families in their courtyard houses to help make customary Chinese dishes or join in playing traditional games. You will also have the opportunity to try some Chinese folk dancing, take calligraphy classes, and much more.

dayInfo.title: Beijing - Tour of the Great Wall and Temple of Heaven
dayInfo.description: Prepare for another day of awe-inspiring exploring, beginning with the magical Temple of Heaven. This quiet park possesses an array of uniquely designed buildings with the centerpiece being the Temple of Heaven complex. It was within this mystical building that emperors prayed once a year to worship heaven for a rich harvest. The triple-eaved temple was carefully constructed to represent what it stood for, adding to its already overwhelming presence. The four wooden pillars that make up the core of the structure represent the four seasons while the 12 columns symbolize the 12 months of the year. These subtle features complement other works of art within the building, such as a carved dragon in the ceiling of the temple, signifying the emperor. As you explore the full variety of structures and immerse yourself in history, you will see the fascinating older generation of locals partaking in their daily exercises, playing traditional board games and engaging with each other which adds to the tranquility that the Temple of Heaven Park boasts. After experiencing the tranquility of the Temple of Heave, you will move next to China’s most famous landmark, the Great Wall. You will embark on a journey to the Mutianyu section of the wall, a peaceful area that draws fewer crowds of people than the main Badaling section. A cable car to the first viewing section of the Great Wall is available as an alternative to the 30-minute hike, but whichever route you take, the stunning scenery of the wall and its surrounding areas will consume you. Famous for the 23 watchtowers that dot its pathway, the Mutianyu section worked to protect Beijing and its imperial tombs, hence its large number of watchtowers. A beautiful assortment of pine trees and an abundance of vegetation either side of the wall make up the surrounding area, while the brickwork of the Great Wall spirals its way over the mountain peaks to serve as the perfect area to experience this wonder of the world.

dayInfo.title: Beijing - Tour of Summer Palace and 798 Art Zone
dayInfo.description: Experience the delights of both ancient and modern Chinese art today as you embark on a journey to both the tranquil Summer Palace and the renowned 798 Art Zone. Begin with the dreamlike Summer Palace as these imperial gardens will have you looking on in wonder as you journey around mazes of temples, palaces, pavilions and halls amid bridges and wharfs that sit atop the calm waters of Kunming Lake. Dating back to 1750, the Summer Palace is famous for its magical garden design and was where former royal families would relax with their guests. Each footstep you take within the garden will lead to a greater feeling of serenity and enchantment as human-made wonders such as the “Tower of the Fragrance of Buddha” and the “Hall that Disciples the Clouds” sit beneath stunning surrounding lakes and gardens. Contemporary art galleries are among the most popular attractions in the world’s biggest cities, and Beijing is no different as millions upon millions flock to the 798 Art Zone each and every year to gaze at the huge variety of displays on offer. The 798 Art Zone is made up of a number of disused factories that have been turned into art galleries. Various areas of the buildings showcase a colossal assortment of art, including work from the likes of Yoko Ono and Andy Warhol. Gaze at sculptures, machinery, stencils and much more, carried out by both established and little-known artists from China and around the world. After a day of contrasting experiences, head back to the hotel before you are transferred to the airport on route to the historical Xi’an. Step off the plane for a quick journey to your hotel and settle in as the day ends.

dayInfo.title: Xi’an – Tour of Terracotta Warriors and Big Wild Goose Pagoda
dayInfo.description: First discovered in 1974, the life-size statues of the Terracotta Warriors were stumbled upon by farmers drilling a well. Made up of horses, chariots, and warriors, these extraordinary pieces of history are sculpted with clay and are over 2,000 years old. Of incredible detail, the sculptures portray the warriors of China’s first emperor: Qin Shihuang. Visiting this fascinating museum will without a doubt be one of the highlights of your trip. Next, move to one of Xi’an’s most famous landmarks with the Big Wild Goose Pagoda. Despite being surrounded by contemporary structures, this stunning pagoda, which dates back to 652 AD, trumps its modern backdrop spectacularly. Unique for its square design, as opposed to the more common circular pagoda design, the structure overlooks the city with a spellbinding presence. Take some time out to reenergize and wander a bit before your guide will escort you to the airport for your flight to the uniquely beautiful city of Chengdu.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu – Panda Keeper Program
dayInfo.description: Wake today ready for an up-close experience with the magnificent pandas. You will take a journey to the Dujiangyan Panda Base, a small city famous for its beautiful mountains and other picturesque natural scenery. Sit down and have a meal with the pandas as you feed them their favorite snacks. Watch the excitement on the pandas’ faces after you’ve decorated and cleaned their enclosures. You can even make some delicious food for the creatures, including special panda cakes. Move next to the nearby Mount Qingcheng, as this beautiful mountainous area features a range of magical temples and mystical buildings amid spectacular greenery. As you venture your way through winding paths and stairways, your eyes will be treated to breathtaking views through the mountain’s peaks. Within its Taoist surroundings burn incense that elegantly travels with the mountain’s breeze subtly adding to this truly enchanting experience.

dayInfo.title: Chengdu - Tour of City, Board for Cruise of Yangtze
dayInfo.description: This morning you’ll explore the fascinating panda-themed city of Chengdu.
